BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Walbro (Ti Automotive) 255 LPH Inline Fuel Pump — GSL392 A proven external EFI pump for LS swaps and EFI conversions . The GSL392 delivers up to 255 LPH with consistent pressure for modern systems like Holley Sniper, ACES EFI, FiTech, and OEM-style port injection. Compact, reliable, and easy to plumb with AN adapters. Add EFI Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Add 10 mm × 1.0 → AN Adapters Add PTFE Hose & Ends Add Install Tools What’s included Walbro/Ti Automotive GSL392 255 LPH inline fuel pump (12 VDC) Adapters sold separately: pump has 10 mm × 1.0 threaded ports (inlet & outlet). Use metric-to-AN adapters to connect PTFE AN hose. 255 LPH inline design: reliable flow for EFI swaps and street performance. EFI-ready pressure: designed for systems targeting up to ~60 PSI base pressure. Universal mounting: compact body fits most frame-rail layouts with isolator clamps. AN-friendly: plumbs cleanly with 10 mm × 1.0 → AN adapters and PTFE hose. Performance & specs Flow rate 255 LPH (inline) Max pressure Up to ~60 PSI Voltage 12 VDC Ports 10 mm × 1.0 inlet & outlet (adapters required for AN) Pump type External inline EFI pump Compatibility LS swaps, Holley Sniper, ACES EFI, FiTech, and similar EFI systems Ideal use cases LS engine swaps needing a robust external pump solution EFI conversions on classics where in-tank retrofits are not preferred Street builds prioritizing reliability and easy service access Install notes: Mount low, near the tank, with rubber isolator clamps to reduce noise and aid priming. Use a coarse pre-filter (40–100 μm) before the pump and a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter after the pump. Adapt 10 mm × 1.0 ports to AN using metric-to-AN adapters , then plumb with PTFE AN hose & ends. After assembly, pressure-test and verify base fuel pressure at the rail. PTFE hose tip: wrap the cut area tightly with tape before cutting with shears to control braid fray, then remove tape after fitting the olive/ferrule. See our install guide . Recommended add-ons EFI fuel filters (≤10 μm) 10 mm × 1.0 → AN adapter fittings (to AN-6 / AN-8) PTFE hose & AN hose-end bundles AN hose install tools (aluminum AN wrench & vice jaws) Mounting clamps & hardware Gauge / pressure port AN adapter Fast Shipping • Free $99+ Expert Support Manufacturer’s Warranty Quick FAQs What fittings do I need to run AN hose? Use 10 mm × 1.0 to AN-6 or AN-8 adapters on the pump’s ports, then connect PTFE AN hose ends. Is a 255 LPH inline pump enough for my LS swap? For many naturally aspirated LS builds and common EFI conversions, yes. For boosted or E85 applications, assess total fuel demand and consider higher flow. Can I run this without a pre-filter? We recommend a coarse pre-filter (40–100 μm) before the pump and a ≤10 μm filter after the pump to protect injectors and the regulator. Warranty Covered by the manufacturer’s warranty (Walbro/Ti Automotive). Terms and duration per manufacturer policy. We’ll help facilitate claims—contact support with your order number and photos. Shipping Fast shipping. Free shipping on orders $99+ . Rates and options shown at checkout. Returns Hassle-free returns on new, unused items in original packaging per our Returns Policy. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support M14 × 1.5 & M16 × 1.5 to AN-6 / AN-8 Female Adapters for GM Sending Units Precision metric specialty adapters that convert GM/Chevy sending unit metric O-ring ports to AN-6 or AN-8 female for modern PTFE hose plumbing. Ideal for OBS and similar GM tanks that use a female metric port with a positive-seal O-ring nose. Choose your adapter Thread size: M14 × 1.5 or M16 × 1.5 (metric straight thread, positive-seal O-ring) AN side: AN-6 female or AN-8 female (swivel) Built to pair with our Spectra FG12-series sending units : FG12M · FG12L · FG12K . Direct conversion: metric O-ring port → AN female, no sketchy stack of adapters. Clean, serviceable connections: pair with PTFE AN hose ends for leak-resistant EFI plumbing. Swap-friendly: perfect for LS/LT EFI upgrades using GM sending units (FG12 series). CNC-machined & anodized: durable finish; use aluminum AN wrenches to prevent marring. Specs Metric side M14 × 1.5 or M16 × 1.5, straight thread, positive-seal O-ring nose (male) AN side AN-6 female or AN-8 female (swivel) Primary use Fuel sending units & modules (GM/OBS and similar) Finish Anodized aluminum Where these adapters shine FG12-series sending units → convert metric O-ring ports to AN for PTFE hose plumbing. EFI conversions & LS/LT swaps using GM tanks/modules. Filter/regulator service when standardizing to AN across the system. Install tips: Confirm your sending unit’s port is female metric O-ring and verify size: M14×1.5 or M16×1.5 (use a pitch gauge). Lightly oil the O-ring. Thread the adapter in by hand to avoid cross-threading; tighten until the O-ring seats. Do not over-torque. On the AN side, use PTFE AN hose ends (choose AN-6 or AN-8 to match). Pressure-test after assembly. For EFI systems, run a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) pressure-side filter. Important: For fuel system use. Not for brake or power steering circuits. Recommended add-ons FG12-series EFI sending units (GM 73–87 Blazer/Suburban) · FG12M / FG12L / FG12K Extra PTFE AN hose ends (select AN-6 or AN-8) AN hose install tools (aluminum AN wrench & vice jaws) EFI fuel filters (≤10 μm) Gauge / pressure port AN adapter Hardline tube → AN adapters Lifetime Warranty on adapter fittings Fast Shipping • Free $99+ Expert Support Quick FAQs Will this fit my FG12 sending unit? Yes—these are designed for GM metric O-ring ports found on FG12-series units. Verify your port size: M14×1.5 or M16×1.5 . AN-6 or AN-8—what should I choose? AN-6 suits most EFI feed/return setups. Use AN-8 where higher flow is needed. Keep AN size consistent with the rest of your system. Does the adapter include an O-ring? Use a fresh, fuel-compatible O-ring sized for the metric port groove. Inspect and replace any worn O-rings during service. Warranty Adapter fittings are covered by our lifetime warranty against manufacturing defects. Shipping Fast shipping. Free shipping on orders $99+ . Rates and options shown at checkout. Returns Hassle-free returns on new, unused items in original packaging per our Returns Policy. Quality CNC-machined metric-to-AN adapters designed to pair with PTFE AN hose ends for leak-resistant EFI performance. See our Privacy Policy . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive Stealth 340LPH In Tank fuel pump. The Aeromotive Stealth 340LPH In Tank fuel pump is an advanced upgrade designed for enthusiasts seeking enhanced fuel delivery while maintaining compatibility with factory sending units. Ideal for applications requiring above-stock horsepower, this pump fits directly into factory senders, ensuring a seamless installation without modifying your existing fuel system. It supports gasoline and E85 fuels, delivering a robust flow rate of 340 liters per hour at a maximum pressure of 90 PSI. Configurations available Available in multiple configurations to suit various setups, including model 11569 for GM design (fits square body and G body sending units for EFI) 11540 with a center inlet 11541 with an offset inlet 11542 featuring an offset inlet with the inlet inline with the outlet. This in-tank mounting style pump offers reliable performance and flexibility for high-demand fuel systems. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive inline Fuel Filters with AN male fittings Aeromotive inline fuel filters feature anodized black aluminum housings with AN male fittings, designed for high-performance applications. Available in 100, 40, 10 micron, and 10 micron micro glass (for E85) ratings. These filters provide optimal fuel flow and engine protection. Replaceable elements allow easy maintenance and ensure consistent filtration. Select the appropriate micron rating: 100 micron for pre-pump filtration, 40 micron for post-pump carbureted systems, 10 micron for post-pump EFI systems, and 10 micron micro glass specifically for E85 fuel systems. These filters support higher flow rates to meet the demands of performance engines. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive Inline fuel filter with ORB 10 ports This Aeromotive fuel filter is perfect for high flow applications where a high quality inline fuel filter is desired. The Aeromotive inline fuel filter with female ORB-10 ports is engineered for high-flow, high-performance fuel systems. Featuring replaceable micro glass elements available in 100, 40, and 10 micron ratings, it ensures precise filtration with minimal pressure drop—flowing up to 2,000 pounds per hour at less than 1 PSI. CNC machined from 6061-T6 aircraft aluminum and finished with a corrosion-resistant bright dip black anodize, this filter offers durability and a professional appearance. O-ring boss ports provide secure sealing in demanding applications, and ORB-to-AN adapter fittings are available for seamless integration with AN-10, -08, and -06 lines. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Spectra Premium 190 LPH In-Tank Fuel Pump (SP1115) Built for stock LS engine swaps and EFI conversions up to ~450 HP , this 12 VDC turbine pump delivers consistent flow and pressure for reliable, quiet fuel delivery. Designed to fit GM/Chevy sending units, it’s an easy, durable choice when you want OEM-style drivability with modern EFI performance. Add an EFI Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Shop PTFE Hose Bundles See LS Swap Fuel Line Kits Browse All Fuel Pumps LS swap ready: engineered for stock power levels on factory-style EFI systems. Smooth, quiet turbine: stable delivery across typical EFI pressures. In-tank OEM style: easy to integrate with GM/Chevy sending units. Complete kit feel: includes strainer(s) and gasket(s) to simplify install. Performance & specs Flow Rate 190 LPH (approx. 52.6–58.8 GPH) Pressure Range ~94–116 PSI Voltage 12 VDC Inlet Strainer-type (included) Outlet 5/16\" hose Fuel Compatibility Gasoline (pump includes gas-compatible components) Recommended Power Stock LS / up to ~450 HP (gasoline) Included Strainer(s), gasket(s) Ideal use cases Stock LS engine swaps aimed at OEM-like drivability and reliability. EFI conversions on classic builds where a dependable in-tank solution is preferred. Daily-driven street builds that need quiet operation and consistent pressure. Install notes: Verify your sending unit accepts this pump format and outlet size (5/16\"). Use a fresh strainer and gasket (included). Confirm polarity and hose routing. Pair with a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) EFI fuel filter and the correct regulator for your system. See our fuel filters . After assembly, pressure-test and verify base fuel pressure at the rail. Pro tip for PTFE hose: when cutting braided PTFE hose with shears, wrap the cut area with tape before cutting to control fray, then remove tape after fitting the olive/ferrule. See our Install Instructions . Compatibility & pairing Designed to fit many GM/Chevy sending units. Measure before ordering or choose a matched sending unit from our EFI sending units collection . For returnless setups, pair with a regulator/filter module; for return style, ensure proper return porting and tank baffling. Running E85 or boost? Consider stepping up to higher-LPH options in our fuel pumps collection (E85 typically requires more flow). Add a Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Bundle: PTFE Hose & Fittings Complete LS Swap Kits Fast Shipping • Free $99+ Expert Support Manufacturer’s Warranty Warranty This item is covered by the manufacturer’s warranty (Spectra Premium). Terms and duration per manufacturer policy. We’ll help facilitate warranty claims—contact support with your order number and photos. Shipping Fast shipping. Free shipping on orders $99+ . Rates and options shown at checkout. Returns Hassle-free returns on new, unused items in original packaging per our Returns Policy. Quality Selected to pair perfectly with Hot Rod AN PTFE hose & fittings for leak-free, long-life EFI performance. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Redhorse Performance fuel pressure gauge with white or black face The Redhorse Performance liquid-filled fuel pressure gauge is engineered for precise and dependable fuel pressure monitoring, essential for optimizing engine performance. Available in two measurement ranges—0-15 PSI and 0-100 PSI—it accommodates a variety of fuel system requirements. The gauge features a choice of black or white face options, allowing seamless integration with your vehicle’s interior design. Its liquid-filled construction minimizes needle vibration and enhances durability, providing stable readings even in harsh conditions. Equipped with a 1/8\" NPT male fitting, it ensures a secure and leak-free connection. This gauge is an expert choice for accurate fuel pressure measurement and reliable long-term performance. Mount directly to your fuel pressure regulator if it has a 1/8\" NPT female port or mount inline with one of our gauge port adapter fittings . When mounting a fuel pressure gauge it should be mounted as close as possible to your carb or fuel rail to get an accurate reading. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive fuel pressure gauge 0-100PSI or 0 - 15 PSI with Equalization valve The Aeromotive fuel pressure gauge delivers precise and reliable pressure readings for both fuel injection and carbureted systems. Available in two ranges 0-100 PSI (P/N 15633) 0-15 PSI (P/N 15632) This 1.5” diameter gauge features a liquid-filled design that enhances durability and reduces needle vibration. Equipped with a 1/8″ NPT male connection and an integral equalization valve, it maintains accuracy regardless of external temperature fluctuations. Ideal for high-performance applications. This fuel pressure gauge is compatible with AN fittings utilizing inline gauge port adapter fittings or mount directly to your compatible fuel pressure regulator . This fuel pressure gauge ensures seamless integration into your fuel system for optimal monitoring and control. Fixing inaccurate pressure readings due to engine compartment temperatures Aeromotive liquid-filled fuel pressure gauges incorporate a custom equalizer valve that enables rapid equalization of the gauge case to atmospheric pressure. This feature instantly corrects the gauge reading, ensuring precise and reliable measurements regardless of operating temperature. Designed for durability and accuracy, these gauges provide consistent performance in demanding fuel system applications. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support The Ultimate Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler (LPD-4739) is engineered to enhance transmission longevity by effectively reducing oil temperatures. Its innovative stacked plate design positions the transmission oil closest to the surfaces exposed to airflow, significantly improving heat dissipation and cooling efficiency. This auxiliary cooler is ideal for demanding applications where maintaining optimal transmission temperature is critical. Equipped with 5/8-18 inverted flare ports, it can be easily converted to AN fittings using adapter fittings, ensuring compatibility with Hot Rod AN LLC products for a secure and professional installation. The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler LPD4739 offers superior cooling with its durable brazed aluminum construction, delivering twice the performance of the Tru-Cool LPD. Its precise fin spacing optimizes airflow for efficient heat dissipation, making it ideal when an auxiliary transmission oil cooler is required. Installation hardware is included for a straightforward setup, ensuring reliable protection for your transmission under demanding conditions. How it works The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler LPD4739 features an advanced cold weather passive bypass that enhances fluid flow when automatic transmission fluid (ATF) is thick and viscous in low temperatures. As the ATF warms and thins during operation, the system directs it through the cooler core for efficient heat dissipation. This design ensures optimal heat transfer, maintaining ideal fluid viscosity and providing superior protection against lubrication system failure under varying temperature conditions. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Derale 13 Row Series 9500 Plate & Fin Transmission Cooler Kit – 13633 Protect your transmission and improve performance with the Derale 13 Row Series 9500 Plate & Fin Transmission Cooler Kit , part number 13633 . Designed to meet the demands of light to medium duty vehicles, this cooler is a trusted solution for reducing transmission temperatures—especially during towing, hauling, or daily driving in hot conditions. High-Efficiency Cooling with OEM-Trusted Technology This transmission cooler features a durable furnace-brazed aluminum construction and an advanced plate and fin design with embossed turbulators to increase heat dissipation. These turbulators agitate fluid flow internally, ensuring maximum contact with the cooling surfaces while minimizing pressure drop. As a result, the 13-row cooler efficiently lowers fluid temperatures, helping your transmission run cooler, last longer, and perform better under load. Ideal for Light-Duty Trucks, SUVs & Occasional Towing The Derale Series 9500 transmission cooler is widely used by original equipment manufacturers for OEM towing applications due to its reliable cooling capacity and rugged construction. It's perfectly suited for: Light and medium duty pickups SUVs used for occasional towing or off-road use Daily drivers and street performance builds Vehicles operating in hot climates or hilly terrain Installation-Ready Kit with Multiple Connection Options The Derale 13633 cooler kit comes complete with everything needed for a clean, professional installation: 5/8” inverted flare inlets for secure, leak-free connections 3/8” hose barb adapters included for universal compatibility Mounting hardware and brackets for easy installation on vehicles with 5/16” transmission cooler lines Compact size for flexible mounting in tight engine bays or grille openings Product Benefits: Extend Transmission Life – Reduces overheating and heat-related wear Improve Shifting Performance – Maintains stable fluid temperature for consistent operation Reduce Maintenance Costs – Helps avoid premature transmission failure and fluid breakdown Backed by OEM Trust – Used in factory towing packages Specifications: Part Number: 13633 Cooler Type: Plate & Fin Rows: 13 Core Size: Approx. 10\" W x 7.5\" H x 0.75\" D Inlet/Outlet: 5/8\" -18 inverted flare fittings with 3/8\" hose barb adapters included Mounting Hardware: Included Why Add a Transmission Cooler? Your transmission generates extreme heat, especially when towing, climbing hills, or driving in traffic. Excessive heat is the number one killer of automatic transmissions. A quality external transmission cooler like the Derale Series 9500 helps maintain safe operating temps, preventing slippage, fluid degradation, and premature wear. If you're planning an LS swap, performance build, or just want to protect your investment, this is one of the smartest upgrades you can make. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support AN Y Adapter Fitting – Split or Combine Fuel Flow with Precision Streamline your fuel system with our high-quality AN Y adapter fittings , designed to efficiently split or combine fluid flow in performance automotive, racing, and industrial fuel systems. Whether you're feeding dual fuel rails from a single supply line or merging two return lines into one, this Y-fitting makes complex plumbing easy and reliable. Optimize Fuel Delivery in High-Performance Builds Our AN Y adapter fittings are commonly used in advanced EFI fuel systems , especially in LS swaps and modern performance engines where dual fuel rails are utilized. Instead of running a messy crossover between rails, the Y adapter lets you feed both banks directly from one line— clean, symmetrical, and efficient . Constructed from high-strength aluminum and designed to handle the high pressures and temperatures of today’s engines, these Y adapters ensure leak-free operation and consistent flow where it matters most. Common Uses: Split one fuel feed line to supply dual fuel rails (ideal for LS swaps) Combine dual return lines into a single AN return to the tank Manage nitrous fuel delivery setups Use in custom cooling or oil circulation systems Why Choose Our AN Y Fittings? Efficient Fluid Management – Optimized flow paths to prevent restriction Leak-Free Performance – Engineered to handle high fuel pressures Clean Installation – Eliminates messy crossover plumbing and bulky tees High-Temp Durability – Compatible with gasoline, ethanol, methanol, and oils Available Sizes: AN6 – Perfect for return lines and lower-volume fuel feeds AN8 – Commonly used for high-performance fuel feeds AN10 – Ideal for high-flow fuel systems or return setups Tech Specs: Material: Lightweight CNC-machined aluminum Finish: Anodized for corrosion resistance and durability Thread Type: AN / JIC (37° flare) Configuration: Single inlet to dual outlet, or dual inlet to single outlet Fuel Safe: Yes – works with gasoline, ethanol, diesel, and oil Installation Tip: For best results, use with PTFE AN hose ends and matching hose bundles to ensure maximum sealing and flow consistency across your entire system. Y adapters should be securely mounted or supported in high-vibration areas to prevent stress on fittings. Read More on AN Hose 101 How Hot Rod AN LLC started The Origin of Hot Rod AN LLC – Built from Experience, Driven by Passion Our journey began with a rough but promising Chevy C10 project truck . Like many builds, it demanded more time and money than expected—but it also sparked an idea. During the EFI conversion , we realized how overpriced and limited the options were for high-quality AN PTFE braided hose and AN fittings for performance fuel systems. That frustration led to the original launch of Hot Rod Fuel Hose. We sourced manufacturers, ordered samples, and rigorously tested products to ensure reliability, safety, and compatibility with modern automotive fluids. The goal? Offer high-performance AN hose and fittings at a price that makes sense for everyday builders, racers, and enthusiasts. After Hot Rod Fuel Hose ceased operations, the mission didn't end—it evolved. Hot Rod AN LLC was born to carry the torch and deliver even better service, product selection, and support for the DIY and professional automotive community across the USA and Canada.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":11441,"endCharIdx":15865,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"zaalFIC6qBmsuCY574+F0oKlwKGqTFN1pYye7BIo8L8="}

c3805b35-e732-4043-a016-9307c22c0ed9.__data__: {"id_":"c3805b35-e732-4043-a016-9307c22c0ed9","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:08.131Z","content_length":20894},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"web:https://hotrodan.com/","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:08.131Z","content_length":20894},"hash":"jr6idNUp9KU8dJ3ppCbz30HYrPS7H92NAfOaOergPPs="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"5607b812-3514-4cd7-b11d-9ddbe7ac267a","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:08.131Z","content_length":20894},"hash":"PsDHbkPP8yoj1W6clW/QX4HT4Y4PAghzi7JVkcHDhzM="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"e48a6a19-ad81-44b6-88d8-04a5465367ee","metadata":{},"hash":"0jB0zuWKnSCTIpXHR8m2p/zNW4Lo4VWhRTTcEIp9Ut0="}},"text":"Like many builds, it demanded more time and money than expected—but it also sparked an idea. During the EFI conversion , we realized how overpriced and limited the options were for high-quality AN PTFE braided hose and AN fittings for performance fuel systems. That frustration led to the original launch of Hot Rod Fuel Hose. We sourced manufacturers, ordered samples, and rigorously tested products to ensure reliability, safety, and compatibility with modern automotive fluids. The goal? Offer high-performance AN hose and fittings at a price that makes sense for everyday builders, racers, and enthusiasts. After Hot Rod Fuel Hose ceased operations, the mission didn't end—it evolved. Hot Rod AN LLC was born to carry the torch and deliver even better service, product selection, and support for the DIY and professional automotive community across the USA and Canada. We’re proud to serve customers who are building EFI systems, fuel delivery setups, and complete AN plumbing solutions with confidence. Whether you're working on a classic truck, performance car, or race vehicle, Hot Rod AN LLC is your trusted source for PTFE braided hose, AN fittings, fuel system kits, and more . Read more about Hot Rod AN LLC Fuel Your Build with the Best – AN PTFE Hose, LS Swap Kits & EFI Fuel System Solutions At Hot Rod AN LLC , we specialize in helping builders of all skill levels create reliable, clean, and professional-grade fuel systems using high-quality AN PTFE hose, fittings, and fuel system kits . Whether you're working on an LS swap , upgrading from carbureted to EFI, or building a custom vehicle from scratch, our product lineup is built around one goal—getting you the right parts the first time. We’ve taken the guesswork out of performance plumbing. From complete LS engine fuel system kits to PTFE AN hose fittings and AN hose bundles , every item we carry is tried, tested, and proven to hold up under pressure—even in high-performance and ethanol-blended fuel environments. What sets us apart? It’s more than just quality parts. We design our kits and bundles with the builder in mind. That means fittings that seal, hoses that don’t stink up your garage, and complete solutions that save you time and frustration. We know what works in the real world because we build these systems ourselves, not just stock them on a shelf. Built for LS Swaps, EFI Conversions & Modern Fuel Systems Doing an LS swap on your squarebody C10, K10, or Blazer? Upgrading your classic to EFI? We offer purpose-built solutions to make those installs clean, reliable, and long-lasting. Our fuel system swap kits are built around PTFE hose to eliminate vapor smell and fuel permeation issues common with traditional rubber-based AN hoses. We also carry components like inline and in-tank fuel pumps , high-performance fuel filters , and EFI sending units so you can complete your entire fuel system in one order. No more piecing it together from five different stores. Everything here is curated to work together—and work well. Why PTFE Hose? PTFE-lined AN hose is the future of fuel system plumbing. It resists modern fuels like ethanol and E85, doesn’t break down over time, and virtually eliminates fuel vapor smell. If you’re tired of cracking rubber hoses or the gas odor in your garage, upgrading to PTFE is a must . Our hose kits include everything you need to plumb your project safely and cleanly, including your choice of color, length, and fitting angles. The Hot Rod AN Difference You don’t have to be a fabricator or shop owner to build a clean fuel system. We cater to both weekend wrenchers and professional installers with easy-to-use products, detailed install guides, and custom system planning . Need help figuring out what fittings or hoses you need? Reach out —we’ll guide you through it.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":14993,"endCharIdx":18796,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"DjDGSUTX4NLw9F4CzEn+bpX4FlkSDB1dkdbG+Bk/d5k="}

BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Black Nylon Braid Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a black nylon braid, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Black Nylon Braid with Orange Checks Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a black nylon braid with orange checks, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Black Nylon Braid with Green Checks Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a black nylon braid with green checks, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Stainless Steel Braid Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a stainless steel braid, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Black Nylon Braid with Red Checks Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a black nylon braid with red checks, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . Featuring a black nylon braid with blue checks, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. Featuring a black nylon braid with purple checks, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Black Nylon Braid with Yellow Checks Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a black nylon braid with yellow checks, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, brake fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel Brake fluid E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support PTFE-Lined AN Hose – Black Nylon Braid with Silver Check Pattern Upgrade your automotive plumbing project with high-performance PTFE-lined AN hose from Hot Rod AN LLC. Featuring a black nylon braid with silver check pattern, our hose is purpose-built for reliability, compatibility, and pro-quality appearance — all while eliminating fuel vapor and garage odors caused by rubber-lined hose alternatives. Available in AN6, AN8, and AN10 sizes to suit your specific plumbing needs. Not sure which size is right for your project? Read our guide on AN hose sizes and what they mean for your ride . Why Choose Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose? ✅ PTFE Core: Superior chemical resistance and vapor-proof design ✅ SAE 100R14 Compliant: Built to industry standards for performance and reliability ✅ Eliminates Garage Odor: Vapor lock reduces fuel smell compared to rubber hose ✅ Wide Fluid Compatibility: Suitable for transmission fluid, E85, coolant, oil, and more ✅ Pairs Perfectly With: Hot Rod AN PTFE Hose Fittings Ideal Applications This hose is commonly used in: ✅ EFI fuel systems ✅ LS engine swaps ( browse LS swap kits ) ✅ Transmission cooler lines ✅ Vacuum lines and fluid replacement projects Fluid Compatibility This hose is compatible with the following automotive and industrial fluids: Automatic transmission fluid Bio-Fuel & Diesel E85 / Ethanol / Methanol / Gasoline Engine oil & coolant Vacuum Important Note You must use PTFE hose ends with this product. For the best performance and leak-free results, always use Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose fittings . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Straight AN PTFE Hose End Fittings – Available in AN6, AN8 & AN10 Reliable, chemical-resistant, and built for precision – our Straight AN PTFE Hose End Fittings are engineered to seamlessly connect with **Hot Rod AN PTFE™ stainless or nylon braided hose**, offering leak-free performance for EFI fuel systems, LS swaps, and high-pressure plumbing projects. 🏆 Why Choose These Hose Ends? ✅ Engineered for PTFE-lined hose: compatible with full braided constructions ✅ Available in AN6, AN8, AN10 sizes with multiple anodized color finishes ✅ Straight swivel design provides easy alignment and clean routing ✅ Reusable fittings—just replace the ferrule upon reassembly ✅ Features Hot Rod AN branding with lifetime warranty on fittings ⚠️ Pro Installation Tips (from Our Guide) Follow the official instructions for optimal performance: ( Installation Instructions ) 📝 **Tape & mark the hose** before cutting to prevent braid fray and ensure a straight, clean cut. ✂️ Use **hose cutting shears** whenever possible — it gives the cleanest cut with minimal liner distortion. 🔧 Install procedure: slide nut on, gently spread braid, insert ferrule over PTFE liner, press nipple fully, hand-start the nut, then torque to ~1 mm gap using a vice and soft jaws or aluminum spanner wrench. ⚠️ Never reuse ferrules: each installation requires a new ferrule to maintain seal integrity. ✅ Pressure test each line after assembly to check for leaks before running the system.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8325,"endCharIdx":11278,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"o8id8UH/+5+xpxPPDPsPksQZk6B8J5buCxz1DLf6p9M="}

Use **hose cutting shears** whenever possible — it gives the cleanest cut with minimal liner distortion. 🔧 Install procedure: slide nut on, gently spread braid, insert ferrule over PTFE liner, press nipple fully, hand-start the nut, then torque to ~1 mm gap using a vice and soft jaws or aluminum spanner wrench. ⚠️ Never reuse ferrules: each installation requires a new ferrule to maintain seal integrity. ✅ Pressure test each line after assembly to check for leaks before running the system. 🔧 Build-Out Essentials: Complete Your Fuel System 🔩 PTFE Hose & Fitting Bundles Skip guesswork – get matched hose and fittings ready to install: PTFE AN Hose & Fitting Kits – available in AN6, AN8, AN10, color-coded for style 🚗 LS Swap Fuel System Kits All-in-one kits for return or return-less LS EFI conversions, including hose, fittings, and essential adapters: LS Engine AN Fuel System Kits 🔄 More Hose Fittings (Angled, Special, Etc.) Hose Ends Collection – straight, 45°, 90°, 180° in AN6–AN10 💧 Fuel Pumps Compatible with AN Lines Spectra 190 LPH – good for stock LS setups (~450 HP) Walbro 255 LPH – fits medium builds (~600 HP) Aeromotive 340 LPH – supports up to ~850 HP 🧼 Fuel Filters for Injector & Pump Protection Inline Fuel Filters Collection – AN6-fitting compatible filters designed for EFI systems 🛠 Installation Tools – Make It Easy Achieve professional results with the right tools: AN Hose Installation Tools – including aluminum spanner wrench, hose shears, and cutters 📐 Fitment & Compatibility Summary • Straight AN hose ends compatible only with Hot Rod AN PTFE braided hose (stainless or nylon braid). • Available in AN6, AN8, AN10 sizes to match fuel, oil, or cooler system requirements. • Suitable for EFI fuel lines, LS engine swaps, oil cooler, power steering, and transmission lines. • Follow installation guide to ensure clean cuts, proper seal, and long-lasting performance. 🏁 Final Word Tight tolerances, premium materials, and thoughtful design make our straight AN PTFE hose ends the ideal choice for high-pressure builds. Backed by installation guidance, tool recommendations, and seamless compatibility with other HotRodAN products — you’re not just buying a fitting, you're building confidence from start to finish. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Spectra EFI Sending Units for Squarebody LS Swaps and EFI systems – FG05M & FG05N Upgrade your Squarebody Chevy or GMC truck fuel system for EFI and LS power with the Spectra FG05M (Driver Side) and FG05N (Passenger Side) EFI sending units. These OE-style replacement units allow you to drop a high-pressure fuel pump directly into your factory-style tank – the cleanest way to fuel your LS swap or EFI conversion project. We recommend pairing these sending units with a 1987+ fuel tank for best fit and compatibility with modern EFI systems. Why Choose FG05M & FG05N for Your EFI Build? ✅ Direct-fit for Squarebody tanks – Designed to replace factory sending units ✅ EFI-ready design – Supports in-tank fuel pumps for clean and quiet operation ✅ Perfect for LS swaps – Get the pressure and volume your new engine needs ✅ Choose the correct side – FG05M = Driver side / FG05N = Passenger side ✅ Works with multiple pumps – See options below based on horsepower Recommended In-Tank Fuel Pumps: 🔧 Spectra 190LPH Pump – For stock LS swaps up to 450HP – Click Here 🔧 Walbro 255LPH Pump – Supports builds up to 600HP – Click Here 🔧 Aeromotive 340LPH Pump – For high-performance setups up to 850HP – Click Here Don’t Forget Your Adapter Fittings: These sending units feature factory-style hard line outlets (3/8\" & 5/16\") and require adapter fittings to convert to AN-style fuel systems: 🧰 Hard Line to AN Adapter Fittings – Click Here Fitment & Compatibility: ✔️ Designed for Squarebody Chevy/GMC pickups (1973–1987) ✔️ Compatible with EFI fuel pumps ✔️ Recommended upgrade to 1987+ fuel tank for best performance ✔️ Choose FG05M (driver side) or FG05N (passenger side) based on your tank configuration Tech Tip: Mounting an in-tank EFI pump helps eliminate external noise , prevents vapor lock , and makes your build look cleaner. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Corvette-Style 58 PSI Filter/Regulator — LS Swap (Includes AN-6 Adapters) The simplest path to a return-less LS : regulate to ~58 PSI at the tank, run a single AN-6 feed to the rail, and send excess fuel right back to the tank. This unit combines a fixed-pressure regulator and EFI filter in one body and ships with AN-6 adapters for all three ports ( IN , OUT , RETURN ) for clean, leak-free plumbing. ✅ Fixed ~58 PSI for Gen III/IV LS ✅ IN / OUT / RETURN clearly labeled ✅ Includes -6 AN adapters (all ports) ✅ Ideal for return-less layouts ✅ Mounts near tank to reduce heat & noise How it plumbs (return-less) Pump → IN (on this filter/regulator). OUT → Rail feed (single AN-6 line to engine bay). RETURN → Tank (short return line at the rear). FEED 3/8″ → IN (−6 AN) OUT → Rail feed (3/8″ at rail) RETURN 5/16″ → Tank Tank In-tank Pump RETURN (5/16″) FEED (3/8″) Sending Unit (feed & return) Filter / Regulator Fixed ~58 PSI IN RETURN OUT Rail Feed 3/8″ QC at rail Mount filter/regulator near the tank on the frame rail • Support & heat-shield lines Flow (top lanes): FEED 3/8″ from sending unit → Filter/Reg IN • OUT → rail • RETURN 5/16″ → tank. Specs & guidance Base pressure: ~58 PSI (typical Gen III/IV LS) Ports: IN / OUT / RETURN — supplied with -6 AN ends Native Corvette QC sizes: 3/8″ feed/outlet , 5/16″ return Placement: mount near the tank on the frame; follow arrow for flow direction Filtration: Use a ≤10 µm EFI filter. For stock/near-stock flow, see our Factory-Style Inline Filter Kit (AN-6) ; for higher flow, shop the Fuel Filters collection . Fuel compatibility: gasoline; confirm element choice if running E85 Pairs perfectly with Return-Less LS Fuel Line Kit (PTFE AN-6) — single feed to the rail; clamps & fittings included. AN adapter fittings — sending-unit and tank return ports. Install tools — cutter, vise jaws, and AN wrenches. Install instructions & Hose 101 Installation hub — mounting tips & routing diagrams. PTFE hose & AN fittings — step-by-step AN Hose 101 articles — regulators, filters, routing fundamentals. FAQs Is this the right choice for my LS? Yes for most Gen III/IV return-less swaps targeting ~58 PSI. It simplifies plumbing and keeps the bay clean. If you run a very large pump or big boost, step up to a true return-style regulator. AN adapter fittings — sending-unit and tank return ports. Install tools — cutter, vise jaws, and AN wrenches. Install instructions & Hose 101 Installation hub — mounting tips & routing diagrams. PTFE hose & AN fittings — step-by-step AN Hose 101 articles — regulators, filters, routing fundamentals. FAQs Is this the right choice for my LS? Yes for most Gen III/IV return-less swaps targeting ~58 PSI. It simplifies plumbing and keeps the bay clean. If you run a very large pump or big boost, step up to a true return-style regulator. Where should I mount it? Near the tank on the frame rail. Keep lines supported with cushioned clamps and protected from heat/road debris. Follow the arrow for flow direction. What hose size? Most swaps use -6 AN feed to the rail. Planning future power? Consider a larger feed or a return-style regulator to increase bypass capacity. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Factory-Style Inline EFI Fuel Filter — ≤10 µm (Includes -6 AN Fittings) The right micron, the right ends, the right flow. This factory-style inline filter gives your EFI swap ≤10 µm filtration with -6 AN fittings already on the body. Follow the flow arrow ( IN→OUT ), mount it on the frame near the tank, and enjoy clean, stable fuel delivery—no guesswork. Why this filter: EFI-correct filtration (≤10 µm) to protect injectors -6 AN ends included for simple, leak-free plumbing Clear flow arrow and compact body for easy placement Serviceable element —stock a spare for quick swaps Add a Spare Element — 20% Off* One click adds the filter + replacement element. Add Filter + Element *Discount applied at checkout with code FILTERPAIR20 How it plumbs Pump → Filter IN Filter OUT → Rail / Regulator Pump Filter IN → OUT (arrow) Rail / Reg EFI (LS ~58 PSI) Flow direction matters: Pump → IN on the filter, OUT → Rail/Regulator . Mount on the frame near the tank, away from heat and debris. Specs Filtration ≤10 µm (EFI) Ends -6 AN fittings included (both sides) Flow direction Arrow on body: IN → OUT Service Replaceable element ( buy spare element ) Compatibility Gasoline; verify element for E85 blends Placement Frame rail near tank; protected from heat/rocks Placement & tips Mount on the frame near the tank for cooler fuel and shorter return lines. Support with rubber-cushioned clamps and keep away from exhaust/road debris. Prime the system, check for leaks, and verify pressure at the rail/ECU target (LS ~58 PSI). Complete the system: Replacement filter element — keep one on hand for service. EFI quick-connect → AN adapters — 3/8″ feed & 5/16″ return for LS rails/regulators. 58 PSI Corvette-style filter/regulator — for return-less layouts. Return-Less LS Fuel Line Kit & Return-Style LS Kit PTFE AN hose-end fittings & install tools FAQs Why ≤10 µm for EFI? EFI injectors need fine filtration to protect pintles and maintain spray pattern. ≤10 µm on the pressure side is the common OEM-style spec for LS swaps. Where should I mount it? On the frame near the tank, in a cool, protected spot. Follow the arrow IN → OUT , then run to the rail/regulator. Is the element E85-compatible? The housing accepts service elements. Verify the element media for your fuel (gasoline/E85). We stock the replacement element here. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Replacement Element for Factory Style Inline Fuel Filter – 5 Micron Keep your fuel system running at peak performance with this inline fuel filter replacement element , designed for use with our Factory Style Inline Fuel Filter Kit . Swapping this serviceable 5-micron filter element takes only minutes — no need to replace your fittings or lines. It's the smart way to maintain flow and protection in any EFI or LS engine swap setup. Why You Need This Replacement Fuel Filter Element Direct Replacement: Fits our Factory Style Inline Fuel Filter perfectly. 5-Micron Rating: Ensures optimal fuel filtration for EFI systems, LS engines, and performance applications. Quick & Easy Maintenance: Keep an extra on hand for stress-free servicing — no tools or line removal needed. Cost-Effective Longevity: Replace the element, not the entire assembly. What's Included ✔️ 1x Inline Fuel Filter Replacement Element ❌ AN adapter fittings not included (sold separately) Need the Full Kit or Adapter Fittings? ✅ Factory Style Fuel Filter Kit – includes element and 6AN adapters ✅ AN Adapter Fittings – sold separately if needed Compatible With This replacement element is designed to fit Hot Rod AN’s factory-style inline fuel filter, used in LS swaps, EFI conversions, and high-pressure fuel systems using AN hose plumbing. Installation Resources Need help replacing this element or building your fuel system? Check out our installation guide or submit a custom system build request . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support EFI Quick-Connect to AN Adapter — 3/8″ & 5/16″ to -6 / -8 AN (LS Rail / Regulator) Snap your factory EFI quick-connects to AN hose—no weird hacks, no leaks. Choose the exact size you need: 3/8″ feed or 5/16″ return on the OEM side, and -6 AN or -8 AN on the hose side. Perfect for LS rail connections, Corvette 58 PSI filter/reg installs, and any SAE EFI quick-connect that needs to meet AN plumbing. Why this adapter: Match OEM quick-connect to AN hose for clean, serviceable plumbing Exact sizes for LS rails: 3/8″ feed , 5/16″ return Choose your hose end: -6 AN (most builds) or -8 AN (bigger flow) How it connects FEED 3/8″ QC → AN To AN Hose (-6 / -8) RETURN 5/16″ QC → AN To AN Hose (-6 / -8) Rail Feed 3/8″ QC Return 5/16″ QC Adapter QC → AN Adapter QC → AN AN Hose -6 or -8 AN AN Hose -6 or -8 AN Factory quick-connect (3/8″ feed or 5/16″ return) → Adapter → AN hose end . Pick the OEM side and AN size to match your build. What to choose OEM side: LS rails are commonly 3/8″ feed and 5/16″ return . AN size: -6 AN suits most swaps; choose -8 AN for higher flow headroom. Where it fits LS rail feed/return quick-connects Corvette-style 58 PSI filter/regulator ports (return-less layouts) Other SAE EFI quick-connect components that need to step to AN hose Install basics Lightly lubricate the QC O-ring with clean engine oil. Push straight until you feel/hear the click ; then perform a gentle tug test. Attach the AN flare end—no tape or sealant on 37° flares. Support the line and re-check for leaks. Attach the AN flare end—no tape or sealant on 37° flares. Support the line and re-check for leaks. Pairs perfectly with: Return-Less LS Fuel Line Kit & Return-Style LS Kit PTFE AN Hose-End Fittings EFI Fuel Filters (≤10 µm) & Factory-Style Filter Kit Hard-Line → AN Adapters (if you’re not using quick-connects) Install Tools FAQs How do I tell 3/8″ from 5/16″? Measure the outside diameter of the hard line: 3/8″ ≈ 0.375″; 5/16″ ≈ 0.312″. Most LS rails are 3/8″ feed and 5/16″ return. Will this fit my rail or regulator? Yes if it uses the common SAE EFI quick-connect style. Not for flare, NPT, or spring-lock connections. Do I need sealant? No sealant on the quick-connect. On the AN side, 37° flares seal metal-to-metal—no tape or paste. See our Privacy Policy . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Hardline Tube to AN Male Adapters Adapt factory hardlines to AN fittings for clean, leak-free fuel systems. Works with 1/4\" , 5/16\" , 3/8\" , and 1/2\" hardline. Rated to 250 PSI when properly installed. Shop PTFE Hose Bundles Shop LS Swap Fuel Line Kits Convert OEM hardlines to AN in minutes—no guesswork, no cobbled adapters. Perfect for EFI conversions, LS/LT swaps, and fresh fuel plumbing. Clean, serviceable connections that pair with Hot Rod AN PTFE hose and fittings. Common hardline sizes supported: 1/4\", 5/16\", 3/8\", 1/2\". Pressure rating: up to 250 PSI when properly installed. Where these adapters shine Fuel sending unit outlets to AN for modern hose routing. Factory feed/return lines to AN when upgrading to PTFE hose. Carb-to-EFI conversions (regulator, filter, return line updates). LS/LT swaps : integrate OEM truck/car hardlines with AN systems. External fuel filter/regulator installs with Hardline smooth tube for rubber hose Specs Hardline sizes 1/4\", 5/16\", 3/8\", 1/2\" Outlet AN male (select size in options) Pressure Up to 250 PSI (proper install required) Primary use Fuel system plumbing Install tips: Measure hardline OD (outside diameter) and select the matching adapter. Cut the tube square and de-burr inside and outside (critical for sealing). Follow the adapter’s assembly order (nut/sleeve/compression as applicable) and tighten per spec. After assembly, pressure-test the system before driving. Important: For fuel system use only. Not for brake lines or power steering. Bundle & Save: PTFE Hose Kits Complete LS Swap Fuel Line Kits Lifetime Warranty Free Shipping $99+ (USA) Real Expert Support FAQs How do I pick the right size? Match the adapter to your hardline’s measured OD (1/4\", 5/16\", 3/8\", or 1/2\"). Then select the AN outlet size to fit your hose/fitting system. Will this work for an LS swap? Yes—these are ideal for connecting OEM hardlines to AN for modern fuel systems. For a complete plumbing solution, see our LS swap fuel line kits . What pressure can it handle? Up to 250 PSI when properly installed and verified by a pressure test. What hose should I pair with this? Use Hot Rod AN PTFE hose bundles and AN hose ends for a complete, ethanol-compatible EFI setup. Any installation cautions? Always cut/deburr properly, assemble in the correct order, tighten to spec, and pressure-test. Do not use for brake or power steering circuits. Warranty Backed by our lifetime warranty against manufacturing defects. Contact support with your order number and photos for a quick resolution. Shipping Fast shipping from the USA. Free shipping on orders $99+ (USA).","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8312,"endCharIdx":12426,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"VRglmHDqTUoHo7q12Ap/NjIHF2UXt02AUXKPsxrOy2M="}

BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Positive-Seal O-Ring Fittings to AN Male Seal metric straight-thread (positive-seal O-ring) ports to AN plumbing—clean, leak-free, EFI-ready. Available in M14×1.5 , M16×1.5 , and M18×1.5 to AN-6 or AN-8 male. Shop PTFE Hose Bundles Shop PTFE Hose Ends See LS Swap Kits Install Instructions Positive-seal O-ring interface for reliable, serviceable connections on metric ports. Direct to AN : adapt to AN-6 or AN-8 for modern PTFE hose plumbing. Perfect for EFI upgrades & swaps : fuel filters, fuel rails, regulators, and sending units. Machined aluminum construction with anodized finish (fitting-safe when used with aluminum wrenches). Sizes & options Metric Thread (Positive-Seal) AN Male Outlet Typical Use* M14 × 1.5 AN-6 or AN-8 Fuel filter/rail, compact modules M16 × 1.5 AN-6 or AN-8 Fuel filter housings, regulators M18 × 1.5 AN-6 or AN-8 High-flow fuel modules, rails *Representative examples. Verify thread size/pitch on your specific component before ordering. Where these adapters shine Factory fuel filters with metric O-ring ports → convert to AN for PTFE hose. Fuel rails & regulators during EFI conversions or LS/LT swaps. Fuel sending units & modules when re-plumbing return or feed lines. Install tips: Confirm thread size and 1.5 mm pitch (M14/M16/M18). Check with a thread-pitch gauge. Lightly oil the O-ring. Thread in by hand to avoid cross-threading, then tighten until the O-ring seats. Do not over-torque. Adapt the AN male to your system with PTFE AN hose ends and hose bundles . Pressure-test after assembly. Replace any worn or nicked O-rings. Important: For fuel system use. Not for brake or power steering circuits. Bundle & Save: PTFE Hose Kits Complete LS Swap Fuel Line Kits Lifetime Warranty Free Shipping $99+ (USA) Real Expert Support FAQs Is this an ORB (SAE) fitting? No—these are metric straight-thread fittings that seal with a positive-seal O-ring (M14×1.5, M16×1.5, M18×1.5). Match the thread and pitch on your component. Which AN size should I choose? AN-6 is the most common for EFI feed/return lines; use AN-8 where higher flow is needed. Keep AN size consistent with the rest of your system. Do these include an O-ring? Yes a fresh O-ring that matches the metric port groove and fuel compatibility. Inspect and replace any worn O-rings during service. Warranty Backed by our lifetime warranty against manufacturing defects.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8324,"endCharIdx":12265,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"R0J50VOJLWMDyLgEWFN1kDd0bDrzLYVUri6mCFR8SS4="}

Eight total: 4 straight, 2 × 45°, 2 × 90° — all AN6 and color-matched per your selection. Do I need to tape the hose before cutting? Yes. Wrap the cut area tightly with tape before using shears to control braid fray. Remove the tape after seating the olive/ferrule. What filter should I use for EFI? Use a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter on the pressure side. See our fuel filters . Can I use this for brakes or power steering? No. This kit is not intended for brake or power steering systems. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support AN8 PTFE Hose and Fittings Kit – Customizable Length & Color Options This AN8 PTFE hose and fitting kit offers exceptional durability and performance for your automotive plumbing needs. Built to handle high pressure and compatible with ethanol-based fuels, it's the smart upgrade for any modern build. Customize Your Ride With Hot Rod AN LLC, you don’t just get performance — you get personalization . Choose the hose length and select matching or contrasting fitting colors to match your engine bay, theme, or personal taste. Whether you want to coordinate with your paint or create a high-contrast showpiece, this kit lets you build your way. What's Included in This Kit ✔️ Your selected length of PTFE-lined AN8 hose ✔️ 8 PTFE hose end fittings: 4 Straight AN8 PTFE fittings 2 45-Degree AN8 PTFE fittings 2 90-Degree AN8 PTFE fittings ✔️ Your choice of fitting and hose color Why Choose PTFE Over Rubber? PTFE-lined AN hose is the gold standard for modern automotive plumbing. Unlike rubber-lined hose, PTFE is compatible with today’s ethanol-blended fuels, resists vapor permeation, and offers extreme durability under pressure and heat. ✅ Compatible with gasoline, ethanol, transmission fluid, engine oil, and more ✅ Zero fuel odor and vapor loss over time ✅ Longer service life than rubber hose ✅ Lifetime warranty for peace of mind Perfect For: EFI conversions LSx engine swaps Transmission oil cooler lines Engine oil cooler lines Replacing aging fuel or fluid lines Recommended Add-Ons Extra PTFE Hose End Fittings AN Adapter Fittings Fuel Filters Fuel Pumps Fuel Pressure Regulators AN Hose Install Tools Need Help with Your Setup? Built to handle high pressure and compatible with ethanol-based fuels, it's the smart upgrade for any modern build. Customize Your Ride With Hot Rod AN LLC, you don’t just get performance — you get personalization . What's Included in This Kit ✔️ Your selected length of PTFE-lined AN10 hose ✔️ 8 PTFE hose end fittings: 4 Straight AN10 PTFE fittings 2 45-Degree AN10 PTFE fittings 2 90-Degree AN10 PTFE fittings ✔️ Your choice of fitting and hose color Why Choose PTFE Over Rubber? PTFE-lined AN hose is the gold standard for modern automotive plumbing. Customize Your Ride With Hot Rod AN LLC, you don’t just get performance — you get personalization . Choose the hose length for stainless AN6 braided hose and select matching or contrasting fitting colors to match your engine bay, theme, or personal taste. What's Included in This Kit ✔️ Your selected length of PTFE-lined stainless braided AN6 hose ✔️ 8 PTFE hose end fittings: 4 Straight AN6 PTFE fittings 2 45-Degree AN6 PTFE fittings 2 90-Degree AN6 PTFE fittings ✔️ Your choice of fitting and hose color Why Choose PTFE Over Rubber? PTFE-lined AN hose is the gold standard for modern automotive plumbing. Unlike rubber-lined hose, PTFE is compatible with today’s ethanol-blended fuels, resists vapor permeation, and offers extreme durability under pressure and heat. ✅ Compatible with gasoline, ethanol, transmission fluid, engine oil, and more ✅ Zero fuel odor and vapor loss over time ✅ Longer service life than rubber hose ✅ Lifetime warranty for peace of mind Perfect For: EFI conversions LSx engine swaps Transmission oil cooler lines Engine oil cooler lines Replacing aging fuel or fluid lines Recommended Add-Ons Extra PTFE Hose End Fittings AN Adapter Fittings Fuel Filters Fuel Pumps Fuel Pressure Regulators AN Hose Install Tools Need Help with Your Setup? BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Stainless AN8 PTFE Hose and Fittings Kit – Premium Finish, Superior Durability This stainless steel AN8 PTFE hose and fitting kit offers exceptional durability and performance for your automotive plumbing needs. Built to handle high pressure and compatible with ethanol-based fuels, it's the smart upgrade for any modern build. Customize Your Ride With Hot Rod AN LLC, you don’t just get performance — you get personalization . Choose the hose length of AN8 stainless braided PTFE hose and select matching or contrasting AN fitting colors to match your engine bay, theme, or personal taste. Whether you want to coordinate with your paint or create a high-contrast showpiece, this kit lets you build your way. What's Included in This Kit ✔️ Your selected length of PTFE-lined stainless braided AN8 hose ✔️ 8 PTFE hose end fittings: 4 Straight AN8 PTFE fittings 2 45-Degree AN8 PTFE fittings 2 90-Degree AN8 PTFE fittings ✔️ Your choice of fitting and hose color Why Choose PTFE Over Rubber? PTFE-lined AN hose is the gold standard for modern automotive plumbing. Unlike rubber-lined hose, PTFE is compatible with today’s ethanol-blended fuels, resists vapor permeation, and offers extreme durability under pressure and heat. ✅ Compatible with gasoline, ethanol, transmission fluid, engine oil, and more ✅ Zero fuel odor and vapor loss over time ✅ Longer service life than rubber hose ✅ Lifetime warranty for peace of mind Perfect For: EFI conversions LSx engine swaps Transmission oil cooler lines Engine oil cooler lines Replacing aging fuel or fluid lines Recommended Add-Ons Extra PTFE Hose End Fittings AN Adapter Fittings Fuel Filters Fuel Pumps Fuel Pressure Regulators AN Hose Install Tools Need Help with Your Setup? BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Stainless AN10 PTFE Hose and Fittings Kit – Premium Finish, Superior Durability This stainless steel AN10 PTFE hose and fitting kit offers exceptional durability and performance for your automotive plumbing needs. Built to handle high pressure and compatible with ethanol-based fuels, it's the smart upgrade for any modern build. Customize Your Ride With Hot Rod AN LLC, you don’t just get performance — you get personalization . Choose the hose length of AN10 Stainless braided PTFE lined hose and select matching or contrasting fitting colors to match your engine bay, theme, or personal taste. Whether you want to coordinate with your paint or create a high-contrast showpiece, this kit lets you build your way. What's Included in This Kit ✔️ Your selected length of PTFE-lined stainless braided AN10 hose ✔️ 8 PTFE hose end fittings: 4 Straight AN10 PTFE fittings 2 45-Degree AN10 PTFE fittings 2 90-Degree AN10 PTFE fittings ✔️ Your choice of fitting and hose color Why Choose PTFE Over Rubber? PTFE-lined AN hose is the gold standard for modern automotive plumbing. Unlike rubber-lined hose, PTFE is compatible with today’s ethanol-blended fuels, resists vapor permeation, and offers extreme durability under pressure and heat. ✅ Compatible with gasoline, ethanol, transmission fluid, engine oil, and more ✅ Zero fuel odor and vapor loss over time ✅ Longer service life than rubber hose ✅ Lifetime warranty for peace of mind Perfect For: EFI conversions LSx engine swaps Transmission oil cooler lines Engine oil cooler lines Replacing aging fuel or fluid lines Recommended Add-Ons Extra PTFE Hose End Fittings AN Adapter Fittings Fuel Filters Fuel Pumps Fuel Pressure Regulators AN Hose Install Tools Need Help with Your Setup? BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support LS Swap AN Fuel Line Install Kit — Return-Style (PTFE AN-6) True return-style fueling for Gen III/IV LS with the regulator built into the fuel rail . This kit gives you PTFE AN-6 hose and matched fittings for both feed and return , plus OEM-style quick-connects for the rail. Result: steady ~58 PSI at the rail, clean routing, and E85-safe plumbing. What’s in the kit PTFE AN-6 hose — choose length ( 20 / 30 / 40 ft ) and color. PTFE hose-end fittings (8 total) — 4× straight, 2× 45°, 2× 90° . EFI quick-connect adapters — 1× 3/8″ ➝ AN-6 (feed) and 1× 5/16″ ➝ AN-6 (return) . Rubber-cushioned line clamps (10-pack) — tidy, rattle-free mounting. How it plumbs (return-style with rail regulator) Tank/Pump ➝ 10 µm (or better) EFI filter ➝ Rail feed (use the 3/8″ quick-connect → AN-6). Rail return outlet ➝ Return line (use the 5/16″ quick-connect → AN-6) ➝ back to tank/sending-unit return port. The fuel rail’s built-in regulator sets pressure (commonly ~58 PSI). No external/bypass regulator is needed for this layout. Which length should I choose? 20 ft — short wheelbase / tight routing. 30 ft — most cars & trucks (sweet spot). 40 ft — long wheelbase, heat-avoidance detours, service loops. Return-style uses two lines—feed and return. If unsure, size up one step. Required items (not included) EFI fuel filter ≤10 µm — use our Factory-Style Inline Filter Kit (AN-6) for stock-ish flow, or pick a high-flow option from the Fuel Filters collection . Adapter fittings for the tank sending unit — see AN adapter fittings . a785e8c1-7de3-4a3e-adaf-94d5859b28d8.__data__: {"id_":"a785e8c1-7de3-4a3e-adaf-94d5859b28d8","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/return-style-ls-engine-an-fuel-line-install-kit","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:27.137Z","content_length":15632},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"web:https://hotrodan.com/products/return-style-ls-engine-an-fuel-line-install-kit","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/return-style-ls-engine-an-fuel-line-install-kit","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:27.137Z","content_length":15632},"hash":"qh1hCdsuoMvfYqHhmEr70GhJnJTnlLJH99IOZaRP9T0="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"5ae077a8-1151-4d6b-98c5-3d2b98925874","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/return-style-ls-engine-an-fuel-line-install-kit","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:27.137Z","content_length":15632},"hash":"ut3RUWS5Q7q8TFNUacTTbDBTI+p8f7h1IiECcX9Y6w8="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"eb098ea9-ffa2-4617-9644-25160be3c1bb","metadata":{},"hash":"0/Y6L5yusi8PFUNvEufl6g/eSDrtE5DO0AVV5pppl7g="}},"text":"The fuel rail’s built-in regulator sets pressure (commonly ~58 PSI). No external/bypass regulator is needed for this layout. Which length should I choose? 20 ft — short wheelbase / tight routing. 30 ft — most cars & trucks (sweet spot). 40 ft — long wheelbase, heat-avoidance detours, service loops. Return-style uses two lines—feed and return. If unsure, size up one step. Required items (not included) EFI fuel filter ≤10 µm — use our Factory-Style Inline Filter Kit (AN-6) for stock-ish flow, or pick a high-flow option from the Fuel Filters collection . Adapter fittings for the tank sending unit — see AN adapter fittings . Adapter fittings for an inline pump (if using) — from the same AN adapter fittings collection. Recommended add-ons Transmission adapter fittings → AN male (if plumbing cooler lines now). Extra PTFE hose-end fittings for additional angles or service loops. Install tools — PTFE cutter, vise jaws, AN wrenches for clean assembly. Why this kit works PTFE throughout for E85 compatibility, low permeation, and heat resistance. Matched ends (4 straight, 2×45°, 2×90°) make routing predictable and leak-free. OEM-style quick-connects snap to the rail—no guessing at thread adapters. Cushioned clamps keep lines neat and quiet along the frame. Install instructions & Hose 101 PTFE hose & AN fittings — step-by-step (cutting, olive install, clocking, torque). AN Hose 101 — tech library (filter micron, bend radius, sizing, LS specifics). FAQs Do I need a separate fuel pressure regulator? No—the LS rail integrates the regulator on return-style systems. Feed the rail, and run the rail’s 5/16″ return back to the tank. Which rail sizes does this fit? Most LS return-style rails use 3/8″ feed and 5/16″ return quick-connects. This kit includes both adapters to AN-6. Is AN-6 large enough? Yes for most swaps when paired with a proper ≤10 µm EFI filter and pump sized to your power. For extreme builds, contact support for sizing. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support LS Swap AN Fuel Line Kit — Return-Less (PTFE AN-6) One clean AN-6 feed to the rail—pressure control and the return happen at the tank. This kit bundles PTFE hose , matched AN fittings , the Corvette-style 58 PSI filter/regulator , and mounting hardware so your LS swap fuels like a modern car: quiet, stable, and leak-free—even on E85. What’s in the kit PTFE AN-6 hose — choose length ( 20 / 30 / 40 ft ) and color. PTFE hose-end fittings (8 total) — 4× straight, 2× 45°, 2× 90° . 1× 3/8″ EFI quick-connect → AN-6 fitting (common LS rail feed). Corvette-style 58 PSI filter/regulator — rear-mount for return-less layout. 10-pack rubber-cushioned line clamps — tidy, rattle-free routing. How it plumbs (return-less) Pump → IN on Corvette filter/reg (mounted near tank). Filter/reg OUT → single AN-6 feed to the rail (use the included 3/8″ EFI quick-connect adapter). Filter/reg RETURN → back to tank/sending-unit return port. Most LS rails target ~58 PSI . Regulating at the rear shortens the return path, reduces heat in the bay, and smooths idle/starts. Which length should I choose? 20 ft — cars/short wheelbase, tight routing. 30 ft — most trucks/SUVs (typical squarebody routing). 40 ft — long wheelbase, service loops, or complex paths. Other items needed for a successful install Adapter fittings from tank sending unit (return & vent as required) — browse AN adapter fittings . Adapter fittings for inline pump (if used) — see AN adapter fittings . Recommended add-ons Transmission adapter fittings → AN male (if plumbing cooler lines now). Extra PTFE hose-end fittings (if you need more angles or service loops). Fuel pressure regulators (front-mount options for high-flow/boost builds). ≤10 µm EFI fuel filters (if not using the Corvette filter/reg as your pressure filter). Install tools — cutter, vise jaws, AN wrenches for clean PTFE assembly.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8338,"endCharIdx":12311,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"mgBNuPnD54/cTemXoMBa//SRMPupNEE2RUP/LteGFUY="}

aefb4409-2184-4eb3-bafa-00dbba6d7595.__data__: {"id_":"aefb4409-2184-4eb3-bafa-00dbba6d7595","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/return-less-style-an-ls-engine-fuel-line-kit","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:27.774Z","content_length":15787},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"web:https://hotrodan.com/products/return-less-style-an-ls-engine-fuel-line-kit","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/return-less-style-an-ls-engine-fuel-line-kit","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:27.774Z","content_length":15787},"hash":"0s1FpMiDbXfbGptTZkgi7mlNMfwG/HReu1asjeuIW5c="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"91a628e3-7516-4a7f-b8cb-21617c2f5dda","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/return-less-style-an-ls-engine-fuel-line-kit","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:27.774Z","content_length":15787},"hash":"FIFagAqYohYnpms1TRKsl9fI5tgFI/Rn5EPXyZog6Dg="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"8247481e-6820-4793-b039-90822965a705","metadata":{},"hash":"0/Y6L5yusi8PFUNvEufl6g/eSDrtE5DO0AVV5pppl7g="}},"text":"Which length should I choose? 20 ft — cars/short wheelbase, tight routing. 30 ft — most trucks/SUVs (typical squarebody routing). 40 ft — long wheelbase, service loops, or complex paths. Other items needed for a successful install Adapter fittings from tank sending unit (return & vent as required) — browse AN adapter fittings . Adapter fittings for inline pump (if used) — see AN adapter fittings . Recommended add-ons Transmission adapter fittings → AN male (if plumbing cooler lines now). Extra PTFE hose-end fittings (if you need more angles or service loops). Fuel pressure regulators (front-mount options for high-flow/boost builds). ≤10 µm EFI fuel filters (if not using the Corvette filter/reg as your pressure filter). Install tools — cutter, vise jaws, AN wrenches for clean PTFE assembly. Why this kit works PTFE throughout for E85/ethanol compatibility and minimal vapor smell. Matched fittings reduce leak points and headaches—no hunting for angles mid-install. Rear regulation keeps pressure steady at the source and cleans up the engine bay. Clamps included so your routing is neat and rattle-free from day one. Important notes The Corvette-style filter/regulator is great for street/strip. Extremely high-flow pumps (≥ 255–340 LPH ) or boosted combos may need a front-mounted, high-flow return-style regulator from our regulator collection . Confirm your rail connection: most OE LS feeds are 3/8″ EFI quick-connect (included). Aftermarket/early rails may differ—grab the right piece from AN adapter fittings . Install instructions & Hose 101 Installation hub — diagrams, routing tips, best practices. PTFE hose & AN fittings — step-by-step (cutting, clocking, leak-check). AN Hose 101 tech articles — regulators, filters, routing, and more. FAQs Is this truly “return-less”? Yes—only one hose runs to the bay. The return happens at the included Corvette filter/regulator mounted near the tank. Can I run E85? Yes. PTFE hose is E85-safe. Verify your pump, filter/reg, and injectors are E85-rated. What if my rail isn’t 3/8″ quick-connect? No problem—use the correct piece from our AN adapter fittings to match your rail.
