BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support AN PTFE Hose Cutting Shears Make fast, clean, square cuts through stainless or nylon braided PTFE hose without crushing the liner. Purpose-built for AN plumbing, these shears keep your cuts precise so assembly is smooth and leak-free. What’s included 1 × AN PTFE Hose Cutting Shears Engineered for AN-6 / AN-8 / AN-10 / AN-12 braided PTFE hose used in Hot Rod AN systems. Get the Tool Bundle (Shears + Vice Jaws + Wrench) Shop PTFE AN Hose Ends Get PTFE Hose Add Aluminum Vice Jaws & AN Wrench Why these shears Clean, square cuts: minimizes fray and keeps the PTFE liner intact for perfect ferrule seating Stainless-braid capable: designed to power through tough outer braid without crushing the hose Repeatable results: consistent cuts reduce waste and speed up assembly Shop-proven: ideal for EFI fuel, oil, and transmission PTFE lines Ideal for Preparing AN-6 / AN-8 / AN-10 / AN-12 PTFE hoses for Hot Rod AN hose ends Building EFI fuel systems , transmission coolers , and oil cooler lines Service work: shortening or re-terminating existing PTFE lines Pro tips for flawless cuts: Wrap the cut area tightly with tape (mandatory) to control braid fray and support the liner. Align your mark with the shear’s cutting edge and cut square with a single smooth stroke. Remove the tape, then flare the braid slightly and seat the ferrule/olive on the PTFE liner only. Clamp the fitting body in aluminum vice jaws and tighten with an aluminum AN wrench. Full walkthrough: PTFE Hose & AN Fittings Install Instructions . Specs Compatibility Braided PTFE hose (stainless & nylon): AN-6 / AN-8 / AN-10 / AN-12 Cut style Manual shear, square cut Primary use PTFE hose preparation for AN hose ends Finish Durable tool-grade construction Recommended add-ons Tool Bundle: Shears + Vice Jaws + Adjustable AN Wrench PTFE AN hose end fittings (AN-6 / AN-8 / AN-10 / AN-12) PTFE hose (by the foot & bundles) Replacement ferrules (olives) Manufacturer’s Warranty on tools Fast Shipping • Free $99+ Expert Support Quick FAQs Do I need to tape the hose before cutting? Yes—always. Wrap the cut area tightly with tape to control braid fray and support the liner. Remove the tape before seating the ferrule. Will these cut stainless braid cleanly? Yes. These shears are designed to handle stainless braid while protecting the PTFE liner from deformation. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Adjustable AN Aluminum Spanner Wrench for AN Fittings Protect your fittings and speed up assembly with an adjustable aluminum AN spanner designed for precise, mar-free grip on common AN sizes (AN-6 / AN-8 / AN-10 / AN-12) . Purpose-built for professional PTFE hose and AN fitting installs. What’s included 1 × Adjustable aluminum AN spanner wrench — select color (Red or Black) Aluminum jaws reduce the risk of marring the anodized finish on your fittings versus steel wrenches. Get the Tool Bundle (Wrench + Vice Jaws + Cutters) Shop PTFE AN Hose Ends Get PTFE Hose Add Aluminum Vice Jaws & Cutting Shears Why aluminum for AN fittings? Finish-safe: aluminum jaws are kinder to anodized fittings than steel Confident torque: adjustable jaw for snug, controlled tighten without rounding Shop-proven: ideal companion for PTFE hose end assembly and maintenance Style options: available in Red or Black to match your build theme Ideal for Assembling PTFE AN hose ends without damaging the anodized finish Service work on filters, regulators, rails, coolers with AN connections Field adjustments where a single tool must handle multiple AN sizes Specs Fit range Common AN sizes: AN-6, AN-8, AN-10, AN-12 Material Billet aluminum body & jaws Finish Anodized (Red or Black) Primary use Assembly and service of AN fittings in PTFE hose systems Pro tips for flawless installs: Clamp the fitting body in aluminum vice jaws —never in bare steel jaws. Use the adjustable spanner on the nut; tighten smoothly to seat the olive/ferrule. Cut PTFE hose only after tightly taping the cut area to control braid fray; then remove the tape after cutting with quality shears. Finish by pressure-testing the line before driving. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Replacement Ferrules for Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE Hose End Fittings Refresh and reuse your PTFE AN hose ends the right way. These precision replacement ferrules (olives) are made specifically for Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose and PTFE hose end fittings to restore a perfect seal after disassembly. What’s included 5 × replacement PTFE ferrules (olives) — choose your AN size to match your Hot Rod AN PTFE hose & ends One ferrule is required per hose end . A 5-pack typically services two hose ends with spares. Shop PTFE AN Hose Ends Get PTFE Hose Add Install Tools Install Instructions Choose your size Ferrule Size Fits Typical Use AN-6 Hot Rod AN PTFE AN-6 hose & AN-6 PTFE hose ends Most EFI feed/return lines AN-8 Hot Rod AN PTFE AN-8 hose & AN-8 PTFE hose ends High-flow feed, coolers AN-10 Hot Rod AN PTFE AN-10 hose & AN-10 PTFE hose ends Oil/trans cooler runs Compatibility: Designed for Hot Rod AN LLC PTFE hose & PTFE hose ends. Not guaranteed to fit other brands. Exact fit: restores factory-fresh sealing when reusing PTFE hose ends Leak-resistant: properly seats on the PTFE liner for a gas-tight seal Cost-effective: reuse expensive hose ends—replace only the ferrule PTFE-ready: ethanol-compatible and heat-resilient when assembled correctly Pro install tips: Cut back to fresh, undamaged PTFE liner. Wrap the cut area tightly with tape before cutting to control braid fray; remove tape after cutting. Slide the nut over the hose, then seat the new ferrule fully on the PTFE liner—no stray braid under the ferrule. Clamp the fitting body in aluminum vice jaws ; tighten the nut with an aluminum AN wrench until fully seated. Pressure-test the line before driving. For EFI, use a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) pressure-side filter. Full walkthrough: PTFE Hose & AN Fittings Install Instructions . Specs Pack size 5 ferrules (olives) per pack Sizes AN-6, AN-8, AN-10 (Hot Rod AN PTFE systems) Material Precision PTFE/metal ferrule set (as required by our hose ends) Use Reassembly of PTFE AN hose ends to maintain a proper seal Recommended add-ons PTFE AN hose end fittings (match size to ferrules) PTFE hose (by the foot & bundles) AN install tools (aluminum AN wrench, vice jaws, cutting shears) EFI fuel filters (≤10 μm) Quick FAQs Do I need new ferrules when I reuse a PTFE hose end? Yes. PTFE hose ends require a fresh ferrule each time they’re reassembled for a proper seal. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support AN ORB (O-ring) to AN Male Adapter Fitting Straight adapter with male ORB (O-ring boss) on one side and a male AN flare on the other. CNC-machined, black-anodized aluminum for a durable, corrosion-resistant connection in modern fuel and transmission systems. What’s included 1 × AN ORB → AN male straight adapter — select your ORB size and AN size Sold individually. Choose the ORB size to match your port (filter, regulator, rail, pump) and the AN size to match your hose end. Add PTFE AN Hose Ends Shop More AN / ORB Adapters Add a Gauge Port (1/8\" NPT) Add EFI Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Ideal for Fuel filters & regulators (ORB bodies) to AN hose Fuel rails with ORB ports to AN feed/return Transmission coolers & pumps adapting ORB ports to AN lines Note: For fuel and transmission fluid systems. Not for brake or power steering. ORB thread size quick chart ORB Dash Thread (UN/UNF straight) Common Matches -02 ORB 5/16-24 Small sensors, limited use -03 ORB 3/8-24 Niche fuel/aux ports -04 ORB 7/16-20 Small regulators/rails -05 ORB 1/2-20 Occasional filter/reg -06 ORB 9/16-18 Very common fuel rail/regulator/filter ports -08 ORB 3/4-16 High-flow filter/regulator bodies -10 ORB 7/8-14 Pumps, surge tanks, coolers -12 ORB 1-1/16-12 Large filter heads, high-flow regs -16 ORB 1-5/16-12 Big pump/cooler manifolds -20 ORB 1-5/8-12 Very large manifolds/tanks Tip: ORB uses a straight thread and an O-ring to seal in the port. The AN side seals at the 37° flare—no thread sealant on either side. Leak-resistant: ORB O-ring seal on Side A, AN flare seal on Side B Cleaner plumbing: go ORB-to-AN in one step—no clumsy stacks PTFE-ready: pairs perfectly with Hot Rod AN PTFE hose & ends Durable finish: black-anodized aluminum, use aluminum AN wrenches Install tips: Confirm your port’s ORB dash size (see chart) and select the matching adapter. No sealant on ORB or AN flare. Lightly oil the O-ring; hand-start threads; torque until the O-ring seats. On the AN side, keep hose size consistent with your system. For EFI, run a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter on the pressure side and pressure-test after assembly.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8311,"endCharIdx":11915,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"o19XPn4jf9hTPcQ0qlOszUqeMGxLgpLDKgq9YhbFT08="}

Leak-resistant: ORB O-ring seal on Side A, AN flare seal on Side B Cleaner plumbing: go ORB-to-AN in one step—no clumsy stacks PTFE-ready: pairs perfectly with Hot Rod AN PTFE hose & ends Durable finish: black-anodized aluminum, use aluminum AN wrenches Install tips: Confirm your port’s ORB dash size (see chart) and select the matching adapter. No sealant on ORB or AN flare. Lightly oil the O-ring; hand-start threads; torque until the O-ring seats. On the AN side, keep hose size consistent with your system. For EFI, run a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter on the pressure side and pressure-test after assembly. PTFE hose tip: wrap the cut area tightly with tape before shearing; remove tape after seating the olive/ferrule. Full guide: PTFE Hose & AN Fittings Install Instructions . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support NPT to AN Adapter Fittings NPT to AN Adapter Fittings — Reliable Fuel & Oil Connections Convert traditional NPT (National Pipe Thread) ports on fuel pumps, sending units, fuel rails, and regulators to precise AN (Army-Navy) flare connections. These adapters deliver a secure, leak-resistant interface that stands up to high pressure and vibration in performance builds and racing environments. Crafted from durable, corrosion-resistant anodized aluminum in a sleek black finish and available in straight , 45° , and 90° angles to fit tight engine bays and custom layouts. Key Benefits Fast conversion: Bridge NPT ports to AN flare systems across fuel and oil plumbing. Leak-resistant: AN 37° flare seals metal-to-metal; NPT side threads with sealant. Built to last: CNC-machined anodized aluminum resists corrosion and harsh conditions. Angles for any layout: Straight, 45°, and 90° options simplify routing. Technical Specs Thread Type (Side A) AN male, 37° flare (no sealant required) Thread Type (Side B) NPT male, tapered thread (use thread sealant) Material Anodized aluminum Finish Black anodized, corrosion-resistant Available Angles Straight, 45°, 90° Typical Applications Fuel pumps, sending units, fuel rails, regulators, custom EFI plumbing Sealant Note Apply Teflon thread sealant on the NPT side ONLY. Do not use on AN flare. Why Convert NPT to AN? NPT seals via tapered threads and sealant—effective, but prone to loosening under vibration. AN uses a repeatable 37° flare for a robust metal-to-metal seal. With these adapters, you keep existing NPT ports while stepping up to leak-tight AN plumbing for modern EFI performance. Recommended Pairings AN PTFE Hose & Fittings Bundles — build clean, reliable lines to match your adapters. AN Adapter Fittings (Full Collection) — reducers, expanders, ORB, caps & plugs, and more. Gauge/Pressure Port AN Adapter — add a sensor or gauge easily. Hardline Tube to AN Fittings — transition factory hardline to AN flare. AN Hose Installation Tools — faster, cleaner assembly with fewer do-overs. Install Tip Important: Apply Teflon thread sealant to the NPT side only . Do not use sealant on the AN flare. Tighten to snug plus a quarter-turn; do not over-torque. Lifetime Warranty Confidence that lasts as long as your ride. Free Shipping $99+ Add a few essentials & save at checkout. Expert Support Real enthusiasts ready to help you choose. FAQ Do I need thread sealant on both sides? No. Use Teflon thread sealant on the NPT side only.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8326,"endCharIdx":12437,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"8gJZU5LDWv/j0Kpi4EckLD+p6tOXQXW5sDKP71aBoSo="}

The AN side seals via a 37° metal-to-metal flare. Can I use these with PTFE braided hose? Yes. These adapters connect NPT ports to AN hose ends, including PTFE AN hose systems. See our Privacy Policy . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Transmission Adapter Fittings to AN — Sold as a Pair Convert factory transmission cooler ports to clean, serviceable AN male for braided PTFE AN lines. These adapters use 1/4-18 NPSM straight thread and seal at the case seat/washer (not the threads) for a durable, leak-resistant interface in high-heat ATF service. What’s included 2 × transmission adapter fittings (pair) — choose AN-6 or AN-8 2 × sealing washers — the washer/seat does the sealing (threads do not) For 4L70E/4L80E/4L85E : the rear port requires the long/nipple adapter to reach the internal seat. The front port is standard depth. Use the selector above to match your case. Add PTFE AN Hose Ends (AN-6/AN-8) Add PTFE Hose Bundles (AN-6/AN-8) Add Clamps & Mounting Hardware Add Install Tools Choose your transmission & case port Transmission Case Port Thread / Depth AN Male Options Notes Ford C5 / AOD / AODE / 4R70W 1/4-18 NPSM • standard depth AN-6 or AN-8 Threads do not seal; washer/seat does Ford E4OD / 4R100 1/4-18 NPSM • standard depth AN-6 or AN-8 Common retrofit to AN lines GM TH350 / TH400 1/4-18 NPSM • standard depth AN-6 or AN-8 Standard GM case thread GM 200-4R 1/4-18 NPSM • standard depth AN-6 or AN-8 Common retrofit to AN lines GM 700R4 / 4L60E / 4L65E 1/4-18 NPSM • standard depth AN-6 or AN-8 Standard-depth front & rear ports GM 4L70E 1/4-18 NPSM • rear port requires long/nipple AN-6 or AN-8 Front port standard depth; rear uses long/nipple for seat reach GM 4L80E / 4L85E 1/4-18 NPSM • rear port requires long/nipple AN-6 or AN-8 Rear port is deep/stepped; long nose reaches internal seat GM Powerglide (select cases) 1/4-18 NPSM or 1/4-18 NPT (case-dependent) AN-6 Verify NPSM vs NPT before ordering GM 6L80E / 6L90E / 8L90E OE thermostat block retained or replaced AN-6 or AN-8 (via adapter block) Retain OE block or install an AN adapter block Note: Year/casting can vary. Always verify your port depth and choose the long/nipple option where specified. Direct conversion: thread into the case and transition to AN in one move—no stacks of fittings. PTFE compatible: pairs with Hot Rod AN PTFE hose & ends for ATF heat and chemical resistance. Flow-smart sizing: AN-6 suits most builds; upsize to AN-8 for heavy towing/high-HP cooler circuits. CNC-machined, anodized aluminum: durable finish—use aluminum AN wrenches to protect it. Install tips: NPSM ports: sealing occurs at the seat/washer — no thread sealant on NPSM threads. 4L70E / 4L80E / 4L85E: rear port requires long/nipple ; front port is standard depth. Tighten to seal: snug until the washer contacts, then add ~1/8 turn; re-check after first heat cycle. Route lines away from headers/exhaust. Use isolator clamps to prevent vibration wear. PTFE hose tip: wrap the cut area tightly with tape before shearing; remove tape after seating the olive/ferrule. See our install guide . Important: For transmission cooler circuits.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":9822,"endCharIdx":12839,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"qkcW55ZPZftBi48HV/X8GYTcKYb8bGcOjKn3Hbigooo="}

BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support AN Male-to-Male Unions & Reducer/Expander Adapters Connect two female AN hose ends or step between AN sizes with precision-machined male-to-male adapters. Perfect for extending lines, bridging components, or cleanly adapting size without a stack of fittings. What’s included 1× AN male-to-male adapter — choose Union (same size) or Reducer/Expander (size change) Sold individually. For joining two hoses you typically need one union; for size changes select the exact from→to size below. Add PTFE AN Hose Ends Add Install Tools Shop Related AN Adapters Add a Gauge Port Choose your size Type Common Sizes Typical Use Union (same size) AN-4, AN-6, AN-8, AN-10 Join two hoses; extend a line; inline service coupler Reducer AN-8 → AN-6, AN-10 → AN-8, etc. Step down to smaller component ports Expander AN-6 → AN-8, AN-8 → AN-10, etc. Step up for higher-flow sections Tip: Keep AN size consistent with the narrowest part of your system, or intentionally upsize where you need extra flow. Leak-resistant AN flare interface for reliable service in EFI fuel systems. Cleaner plumbing: replace stacks of tees/adapters with one precise union or reducer. Serviceable & modular: makes line extensions and component swaps painless. CNC-machined, anodized aluminum: durable finish—use aluminum AN wrenches to protect it. Where these adapters shine Joining two shorter PTFE AN hoses into one clean run. Adapting component ports (regulator, filter, rail) to your line size. Creating a quick inline service point ahead of a filter or regulator. Specs Ends AN male × AN male (flare) Types Union (same size), Reducer, Expander Material/finish CNC-machined aluminum, anodized Primary use Fuel & fluid plumbing (EFI fuel, oil/trans cooler lines) Important: For the systems above. Not for brake lines or power steering. Install tips: No sealant on AN flare threads. Seal occurs at the 37° flare faces. Hold the body with aluminum vice jaws and tighten using an aluminum AN wrench to avoid marring. Keep fittings to a minimum: unions are great for joining lines, but avoid unnecessary stacks to reduce potential leak points. For EFI systems, run a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter on the pressure side and pressure-test after assembly. PTFE hose tip: wrap the cut area tightly with tape before shearing; remove tape after seating the olive/ferrule. Full guide: PTFE Hose & AN Fittings Install Instructions .","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8322,"endCharIdx":12264,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"Z8fFcfJ81XTbjoj/mht32d3AG4w+TM2/lRVFxLWRNOE="}

BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Gauge Port / Pressure Port Adapter Fitting Add a clean, serviceable 1/8\" NPT pressure port anywhere in your plumbing. This adapter converts AN, ORB, or NPT connections to a convenient 1/8\" NPT gauge/take-off port—perfect for fuel pressure gauges, sensor senders, or diagnostics on EFI systems. What’s included Gauge/Pressure Port Adapter with integrated 1/8\" NPT port (gauge/sensor not included) Select your base connection in the options: AN (flare), ORB (O-ring boss), or NPT (tapered). All versions provide a 1/8\" NPT side port for gauges/senders. Choose your base connection AN (flare) → 1/8\" NPT port: in-line with PTFE hose & AN ends for tidy installs. ORB (O-ring boss) → 1/8\" NPT port: ideal on regulators, filters, and fuel rails. NPT (tapered) → 1/8\" NPT port: add a gauge port to NPT-based hardware. Accurate monitoring: mount a mechanical gauge or sensor where it actually matters. Service-friendly: standardized 1/8\" NPT port for gauges, transducers, or test lines. Clean integration: avoids clumsy tees and stacks of adapters. PTFE system ready: pairs perfectly with PTFE hose and AN fittings for EFI builds. Where this adapter shines Fuel pressure gauges at the regulator, filter outlet, or rail feed. Sensor senders (1/8\" NPT) for EFI data logging or dash inputs. Temporary test ports during tuning and diagnostics. Specs Base side AN (flare) or ORB (O-ring) or NPT (tapered) Port 1/8\" NPT (gauge/sender) Material/finish CNC-machined aluminum, anodized Primary use Fuel system pressure monitoring Install tips: AN flare: no sealant on the flare. Hold the base with soft aluminum vice jaws ; tighten with an aluminum AN wrench. ORB: lightly oil the O-ring; thread by hand to seat the O-ring. Do not over-torque. NPT threads: use a fuel-safe thread sealant or PTFE paste on the NPT threads only (not on AN/ORB). Avoid tape shreds entering the system. Install the gauge/sender into the 1/8\" NPT port with sealant as specified by the gauge manufacturer.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8315,"endCharIdx":12067,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"kDpGpPVio6EBNQ9k2+emhD+KfEvl2B56aqDdjfsKSCk="}

ae04fa68-9e05-4eef-a965-f370355f167c.__data__: {"id_":"ae04fa68-9e05-4eef-a965-f370355f167c","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/gauge-port-or-pressure-port-an-adapter-fitting","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:33.065Z","content_length":15719},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"web:https://hotrodan.com/products/gauge-port-or-pressure-port-an-adapter-fitting","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/gauge-port-or-pressure-port-an-adapter-fitting","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:33.065Z","content_length":15719},"hash":"PI1VEpNNNVBXJUAHzrJll5u2GOAag++92hJ+MXdRXE0="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"b086a19b-8401-4eba-8ce7-a3e3f7b30daa","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/gauge-port-or-pressure-port-an-adapter-fitting","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:33.065Z","content_length":15719},"hash":"UyWiEPfoPAyC4oHuh67vSJIktOmRHdFM8YefrCGXMMY="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"b0c7ffaa-c6e2-4f64-b343-f1df5342fe59","metadata":{},"hash":"0/Y6L5yusi8PFUNvEufl6g/eSDrtE5DO0AVV5pppl7g="}},"text":"Sensor senders (1/8\" NPT) for EFI data logging or dash inputs. Temporary test ports during tuning and diagnostics. Specs Base side AN (flare) or ORB (O-ring) or NPT (tapered) Port 1/8\" NPT (gauge/sender) Material/finish CNC-machined aluminum, anodized Primary use Fuel system pressure monitoring Install tips: AN flare: no sealant on the flare. Hold the base with soft aluminum vice jaws ; tighten with an aluminum AN wrench. ORB: lightly oil the O-ring; thread by hand to seat the O-ring. Do not over-torque. NPT threads: use a fuel-safe thread sealant or PTFE paste on the NPT threads only (not on AN/ORB). Avoid tape shreds entering the system. Install the gauge/sender into the 1/8\" NPT port with sealant as specified by the gauge manufacturer. For EFI, run a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter on the pressure side and pressure-test after assembly. PTFE hose tip: when cutting braided PTFE hose, wrap the cut area tightly with tape before shearing; remove tape after seating the olive/ferrule. See our install guide . Important: For fuel system use. Not for brake or power steering. Shop AN / ORB / NPT Adapters Add PTFE AN Hose Ends Add Install Tools Add EFI Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Recommended add-ons PTFE AN hose end fittings (match your AN size) AN adapter fittings (hardline, metric, Y-adapters) EFI fuel filters (≤10 μm) AN hose install tools (aluminum AN wrench & vice jaws) Lifetime Warranty on adapter fittings Fast Shipping • Free $99+ Expert Support Quick FAQs Will this work on my regulator/fuel rail? Yes—choose the base that matches your port (AN flare, ORB O-ring, or NPT). All versions provide a 1/8\" NPT gauge/sender port. Do I need thread sealant? Use fuel-safe sealant on NPT threads only. Do not use sealant on AN flares or ORB O-rings. Is a plug included for the 1/8\" NPT port? If you need to cap the port, add a 1/8\" NPT plug from our adapters collection. Warranty Adapter fittings are covered by our lifetime warranty against manufacturing defects. Shipping Fast shipping. Free shipping on orders $99+ . Rates and options shown at checkout. Returns Hassle-free returns on new, unused items in original packaging per our Returns Policy. Quality CNC-machined adapter designed to pair with PTFE AN plumbing for leak-resistant EFI performance. See our Privacy Policy . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Walbro/TI 255 LPH In-Tank EFI Fuel Pump Kit — GCA758 A proven upgrade for EFI swaps and refreshes. This in-tank electric pump flows up to 255 LPH and supports typical EFI base pressures with rock-solid delivery. Kit includes the pump and install components for common GM-style sending units—ideal for LS swaps, retrofit tanks, and street/strip builds. Verify your module dimensions and connector before ordering. Why builders choose this pump Trusted output: 255 LPH free-flow rating for healthy headroom on typical EFI systems. Compact & in-tank: Quiet operation and OEM-style packaging; no external pump noise or extra plumbing. Complete kit: Includes pump and install pieces (strainer/sock, short hose, clamps, pigtail—see photos). Swap friendly: Popular across GM retrofit/swap applications when matched to the correct sending unit. Performance & specs Spec Detail Flow Up to 255 LPH (≈67 GPH) free-flow Type In-tank, 12 V electric Typical EFI use Stable supply at common base pressures (≈40–60 PSI with regulator) Included Pump, strainer/sock, short submersible hose, clamps, wiring pigtail (see images for exact contents) Fuel compatibility Gasoline and ethanol blends. For sustained E85 use, upgrade the entire system (filters, hose, seals) and note that long-term service life may be reduced versus gasoline. Fitment & install notes Sending unit: Confirm physical fit (pump length/diameter), electrical connector, and outlet size for your module before install. Filtration: Use the included in-tank strainer and add a ≤10 μm EFI filter on the pressure side to protect injectors. Plumbing: Pair with PTFE AN hose and a return-style EFI regulator for best pressure control. Setup: After assembly, key-on prime, check for leaks, and verify base pressure at the rail. Re-check after the first drive. Compatibility quick-check (GM-style modules) Pump packaging: Verify your sending unit can accept a standard 255 LPH in-tank pump body and strainer footprint (check bracket/strap length and clamp size). Electrical connector: Many retrofit/swap modules use a 2-pin pump lead. This kit includes a pigtail— match polarity (positive to pump “+”), solder/heat-shrink, and route away from the float arm. Outlet & hose: Confirm outlet barb size/orientation and use submersible EFI hose inside the tank. Use EFI clamps—avoid generic worm clamps. Strainer orientation: Choose the strainer angle that clears the bucket floor and avoids the float sweep. Keep the sock level. Top-hat pass-through: Ensure the bulkhead wiring and feed tube are rated for EFI pressure and current draw. Tip: If your module used a small, low-output OE pump, plan to upgrade the pre/post filters and run a proper return-style regulator for stable rail pressure. How much horsepower will a single 255 LPH pump support?","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8339,"endCharIdx":12594,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"z0Pc2lqFV4O58C0sx9RbF+LmFiUdcXaWaUmWiMeP248="}

72b9f746-26e8-40b0-92e8-51e2846ea238.__data__: {"id_":"72b9f746-26e8-40b0-92e8-51e2846ea238","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/walbro-ti-automotive-255-lph-in-tank-fuel-pump-gca758","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:33.747Z","content_length":17923},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"web:https://hotrodan.com/products/walbro-ti-automotive-255-lph-in-tank-fuel-pump-gca758","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/walbro-ti-automotive-255-lph-in-tank-fuel-pump-gca758","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:33.747Z","content_length":17923},"hash":"Xk03sLl4Y7KIS+J7s+2GA9wCog7+YRUCfGjfigPvPes="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"a8f692f2-0c7b-46e4-a4f2-1dddc9ed6c2f","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/walbro-ti-automotive-255-lph-in-tank-fuel-pump-gca758","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:33.747Z","content_length":17923},"hash":"ndbuguPn0oSXGBScdQleOIrc0PZ/lW9e5RG1mBDwEj0="},"NEXT":{"nodeId":"57b576e9-55ef-419b-bdc8-7b258493df7a","metadata":{},"hash":"mKgKsx9nMs7DKUvsSgudi35R+6l8D1pJr0s5ltfJR6I="}},"text":"Electrical connector: Many retrofit/swap modules use a 2-pin pump lead. This kit includes a pigtail— match polarity (positive to pump “+”), solder/heat-shrink, and route away from the float arm. Outlet & hose: Confirm outlet barb size/orientation and use submersible EFI hose inside the tank. Use EFI clamps—avoid generic worm clamps. Strainer orientation: Choose the strainer angle that clears the bucket floor and avoids the float sweep. Keep the sock level. Top-hat pass-through: Ensure the bulkhead wiring and feed tube are rated for EFI pressure and current draw. Tip: If your module used a small, low-output OE pump, plan to upgrade the pre/post filters and run a proper return-style regulator for stable rail pressure. How much horsepower will a single 255 LPH pump support? Gasoline: up to ≈500 wheel hp (≈590 crank hp) at typical EFI base pressure (43.5–58 psi). E85: up to ≈380 wheel hp (≈450 crank hp) at typical EFI base pressure (43.5–58 psi). Assumptions: healthy pump voltage (~13.5 V), clean ≤10 μm post-pump filter, return-style regulator, and properly sized plumbing (-6 / -8 AN). Boosted setups, higher base pressure, hot fuel, or altitude will reduce headroom—leave 15–25% margin. For sustained E85 or more power, step up to a higher-flow or dual-pump solution. Popular add-ons EFI Inline Filter (AN male) Protect injectors (≤10 μm) EFI Inline Filter (ORB ports) Direct ORB hookups ORB/AN Adapters Match your regulator & rails Shop EFI Filter (AN male) Shop EFI Filter (ORB) Shop ORB⇄AN Adapters FAQ Is this pump PWM compatible? Short answer: no. This 255 LPH in-tank pump is a brushed DC design intended for constant 12–14 V supply. Pulse-width modulation (PWM) control can cause excess heat and brush wear, noisy operation, and pressure instability—especially at lower duty cycles. What to do instead: run the pump at full system voltage through a dedicated relay and regulate pressure with a return-style EFI regulator. Factory PWM systems: if your OEM module uses PWM, bypass or reconfigure it to provide constant voltage to the pump, or use a controller designed to supply smooth, non-PWM power. Why it matters: PWM “chopping” reduces effective voltage and can starve the rail under transient load, while also heating the motor and shortening service life. For builds that require electronic flow control, consider a pump/platform engineered for controller operation (often brushless) and pair it with the manufacturer’s recommended controller. Is this pump E85 compatible? Conditionally. The pump and kit components are commonly used with ethanol blends; many sellers list flex-fuel/E85 validation. In practice, sustained full-time E85 can shorten service life versus gasoline, especially if voltage is low or filters are neglected. Best practice: if you plan to run E85 long-term, choose an E85-specific pump and ensure your entire system—filters, hose (SAE J30R10 or PTFE), O-rings, bulkhead pass-throughs—is ethanol rated. Maintenance: E85 can loosen tank deposits; change the post-pump filter early and monitor the in-tank strainer. For occasional E85 use, keep voltage healthy (~13.5 V), avoid clogged filters, and leave extra headroom in your fuel system. What’s the warranty? 90-day manufacturer warranty. Coverage is handled by the pump manufacturer. Keep your proof of purchase and follow their claim process for defects. Every pump is tested before it leaves the factory to verify operation and flow. Use proper filtration (≤10 μm post-pump), wiring/relays, and installation practices—improper setup can void coverage. Need help diagnosing an issue? Contact us first—we can often resolve setup problems before a warranty claim is necessary. What’s included (1) 255 LPH in-tank EFI pump. Install components: strainer, submersible hose, clamps, wiring pigtail (see images for exact contents). Safety: Work in a ventilated area away from ignition sources. Depressurize the system, capture spills, and replace any brittle hoses during service.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":11809,"endCharIdx":15792,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"PN2q3QM8d+N1+IaCXbh1pSUCkXxVP+IAAf2DjPpQZzM="}

BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Walbro (Ti Automotive) 255 LPH Inline Fuel Pump — GSL392 A proven external EFI pump for LS swaps and EFI conversions . The GSL392 delivers up to 255 LPH with consistent pressure for modern systems like Holley Sniper, ACES EFI, FiTech, and OEM-style port injection. Compact, reliable, and easy to plumb with AN adapters. Add EFI Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Add 10 mm × 1.0 → AN Adapters Add PTFE Hose & Ends Add Install Tools What’s included Walbro/Ti Automotive GSL392 255 LPH inline fuel pump (12 VDC) Adapters sold separately: pump has 10 mm × 1.0 threaded ports (inlet & outlet). Use metric-to-AN adapters to connect PTFE AN hose. 255 LPH inline design: reliable flow for EFI swaps and street performance. EFI-ready pressure: designed for systems targeting up to ~60 PSI base pressure. Universal mounting: compact body fits most frame-rail layouts with isolator clamps. AN-friendly: plumbs cleanly with 10 mm × 1.0 → AN adapters and PTFE hose. Performance & specs Flow rate 255 LPH (inline) Max pressure Up to ~60 PSI Voltage 12 VDC Ports 10 mm × 1.0 inlet & outlet (adapters required for AN) Pump type External inline EFI pump Compatibility LS swaps, Holley Sniper, ACES EFI, FiTech, and similar EFI systems Ideal use cases LS engine swaps needing a robust external pump solution EFI conversions on classics where in-tank retrofits are not preferred Street builds prioritizing reliability and easy service access Install notes: Mount low, near the tank, with rubber isolator clamps to reduce noise and aid priming. Use a coarse pre-filter (40–100 μm) before the pump and a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) filter after the pump. Adapt 10 mm × 1.0 ports to AN using metric-to-AN adapters , then plumb with PTFE AN hose & ends. After assembly, pressure-test and verify base fuel pressure at the rail. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support M14 × 1.5 & M16 × 1.5 to AN-6 / AN-8 Female Adapters for GM Sending Units Precision metric specialty adapters that convert GM/Chevy sending unit metric O-ring ports to AN-6 or AN-8 female for modern PTFE hose plumbing. Ideal for OBS and similar GM tanks that use a female metric port with a positive-seal O-ring nose. Choose your adapter Thread size: M14 × 1.5 or M16 × 1.5 (metric straight thread, positive-seal O-ring) AN side: AN-6 female or AN-8 female (swivel) Built to pair with our Spectra FG12-series sending units : FG12M · FG12L · FG12K . Direct conversion: metric O-ring port → AN female, no sketchy stack of adapters. Clean, serviceable connections: pair with PTFE AN hose ends for leak-resistant EFI plumbing. Swap-friendly: perfect for LS/LT EFI upgrades using GM sending units (FG12 series). CNC-machined & anodized: durable finish; use aluminum AN wrenches to prevent marring. Specs Metric side M14 × 1.5 or M16 × 1.5, straight thread, positive-seal O-ring nose (male) AN side AN-6 female or AN-8 female (swivel) Primary use Fuel sending units & modules (GM/OBS and similar) Finish Anodized aluminum Where these adapters shine FG12-series sending units → convert metric O-ring ports to AN for PTFE hose plumbing. EFI conversions & LS/LT swaps using GM tanks/modules. Filter/regulator service when standardizing to AN across the system. Install tips: Confirm your sending unit’s port is female metric O-ring and verify size: M14×1.5 or M16×1.5 (use a pitch gauge). Lightly oil the O-ring. Thread the adapter in by hand to avoid cross-threading; tighten until the O-ring seats. Do not over-torque. On the AN side, use PTFE AN hose ends (choose AN-6 or AN-8 to match). Pressure-test after assembly. For EFI systems, run a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) pressure-side filter. Important: For fuel system use. Not for brake or power steering circuits. Yes—these are designed for GM metric O-ring ports found on FG12-series units. Verify your port size: M14×1.5 or M16×1.5 . AN-6 or AN-8—what should I choose? AN-6 suits most EFI feed/return setups. Use AN-8 where higher flow is needed. Keep AN size consistent with the rest of your system. Does the adapter include an O-ring? Use a fresh, fuel-compatible O-ring sized for the metric port groove. Inspect and replace any worn O-rings during service. Warranty Adapter fittings are covered by our lifetime warranty against manufacturing defects. Shipping Fast shipping. Free shipping on orders $99+ . Rates and options shown at checkout. Returns Hassle-free returns on new, unused items in original packaging per our Returns Policy. See our Privacy Policy . BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive Stealth 340LPH In Tank fuel pump. The Aeromotive Stealth 340LPH In Tank fuel pump is an advanced upgrade designed for enthusiasts seeking enhanced fuel delivery while maintaining compatibility with factory sending units. Ideal for applications requiring above-stock horsepower, this pump fits directly into factory senders, ensuring a seamless installation without modifying your existing fuel system. It supports gasoline and E85 fuels, delivering a robust flow rate of 340 liters per hour at a maximum pressure of 90 PSI. Configurations available Available in multiple configurations to suit various setups, including model 11569 for GM design (fits square body and G body sending units for EFI) 11540 with a center inlet 11541 with an offset inlet 11542 featuring an offset inlet with the inlet inline with the outlet. This in-tank mounting style pump offers reliable performance and flexibility for high-demand fuel systems. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive inline Fuel Filters with AN male fittings Aeromotive inline fuel filters feature anodized black aluminum housings with AN male fittings, designed for high-performance applications. Available in 100, 40, 10 micron, and 10 micron micro glass (for E85) ratings. These filters provide optimal fuel flow and engine protection. Replaceable elements allow easy maintenance and ensure consistent filtration. Select the appropriate micron rating: 100 micron for pre-pump filtration, 40 micron for post-pump carbureted systems, 10 micron for post-pump EFI systems, and 10 micron micro glass specifically for E85 fuel systems. These filters support higher flow rates to meet the demands of performance engines. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive Inline fuel filter with ORB 10 ports This Aeromotive fuel filter is perfect for high flow applications where a high quality inline fuel filter is desired. The Aeromotive inline fuel filter with female ORB-10 ports is engineered for high-flow, high-performance fuel systems. Featuring replaceable micro glass elements available in 100, 40, and 10 micron ratings, it ensures precise filtration with minimal pressure drop—flowing up to 2,000 pounds per hour at less than 1 PSI. CNC machined from 6061-T6 aircraft aluminum and finished with a corrosion-resistant bright dip black anodize, this filter offers durability and a professional appearance. O-ring boss ports provide secure sealing in demanding applications, and ORB-to-AN adapter fittings are available for seamless integration with AN-10, -08, and -06 lines. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Spectra Premium 190 LPH In-Tank Fuel Pump (SP1115) Built for stock LS engine swaps and EFI conversions up to ~450 HP , this 12 VDC turbine pump delivers consistent flow and pressure for reliable, quiet fuel delivery. Designed to fit GM/Chevy sending units, it’s an easy, durable choice when you want OEM-style drivability with modern EFI performance. Add an EFI Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Shop PTFE Hose Bundles See LS Swap Fuel Line Kits Browse All Fuel Pumps LS swap ready: engineered for stock power levels on factory-style EFI systems. Smooth, quiet turbine: stable delivery across typical EFI pressures. In-tank OEM style: easy to integrate with GM/Chevy sending units. Complete kit feel: includes strainer(s) and gasket(s) to simplify install. Performance & specs Flow Rate 190 LPH (approx. 52.6–58.8 GPH) Pressure Range ~94–116 PSI Voltage 12 VDC Inlet Strainer-type (included) Outlet 5/16\" hose Fuel Compatibility Gasoline (pump includes gas-compatible components) Recommended Power Stock LS / up to ~450 HP (gasoline) Included Strainer(s), gasket(s) Ideal use cases Stock LS engine swaps aimed at OEM-like drivability and reliability. EFI conversions on classic builds where a dependable in-tank solution is preferred. Daily-driven street builds that need quiet operation and consistent pressure. Install notes: Verify your sending unit accepts this pump format and outlet size (5/16\"). Use a fresh strainer and gasket (included). Confirm polarity and hose routing. Pair with a 10 micron or finer (≤10 μm) EFI fuel filter and the correct regulator for your system. See our fuel filters . After assembly, pressure-test and verify base fuel pressure at the rail. Pro tip for PTFE hose: when cutting braided PTFE hose with shears, wrap the cut area with tape before cutting to control fray, then remove tape after fitting the olive/ferrule. See our Install Instructions . Compatibility & pairing Designed to fit many GM/Chevy sending units. Measure before ordering or choose a matched sending unit from our EFI sending units collection . For returnless setups, pair with a regulator/filter module; for return style, ensure proper return porting and tank baffling. Running E85 or boost? Consider stepping up to higher-LPH options in our fuel pumps collection (E85 typically requires more flow). Add a Fuel Filter (≤10 μm) Bundle: PTFE Hose & Fittings Complete LS Swap Kits Fast Shipping • Free $99+ Expert Support Manufacturer’s Warranty Warranty This item is covered by the manufacturer’s warranty (Spectra Premium). BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Redhorse Performance fuel pressure gauge with white or black face The Redhorse Performance liquid-filled fuel pressure gauge is engineered for precise and dependable fuel pressure monitoring, essential for optimizing engine performance. Available in two measurement ranges—0-15 PSI and 0-100 PSI—it accommodates a variety of fuel system requirements. The gauge features a choice of black or white face options, allowing seamless integration with your vehicle’s interior design. Its liquid-filled construction minimizes needle vibration and enhances durability, providing stable readings even in harsh conditions. Equipped with a 1/8\" NPT male fitting, it ensures a secure and leak-free connection. This gauge is an expert choice for accurate fuel pressure measurement and reliable long-term performance. Mount directly to your fuel pressure regulator if it has a 1/8\" NPT female port or mount inline with one of our gauge port adapter fittings . When mounting a fuel pressure gauge it should be mounted as close as possible to your carb or fuel rail to get an accurate reading. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Aeromotive fuel pressure gauge 0-100PSI or 0 - 15 PSI with Equalization valve The Aeromotive fuel pressure gauge delivers precise and reliable pressure readings for both fuel injection and carbureted systems. Available in two ranges 0-100 PSI (P/N 15633) 0-15 PSI (P/N 15632) This 1.5” diameter gauge features a liquid-filled design that enhances durability and reduces needle vibration. Equipped with a 1/8″ NPT male connection and an integral equalization valve, it maintains accuracy regardless of external temperature fluctuations. Ideal for high-performance applications. This fuel pressure gauge is compatible with AN fittings utilizing inline gauge port adapter fittings or mount directly to your compatible fuel pressure regulator . This fuel pressure gauge ensures seamless integration into your fuel system for optimal monitoring and control. Fixing inaccurate pressure readings due to engine compartment temperatures Aeromotive liquid-filled fuel pressure gauges incorporate a custom equalizer valve that enables rapid equalization of the gauge case to atmospheric pressure. This feature instantly corrects the gauge reading, ensuring precise and reliable measurements regardless of operating temperature. Designed for durability and accuracy, these gauges provide consistent performance in demanding fuel system applications. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support The Ultimate Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler (LPD-4739) is engineered to enhance transmission longevity by effectively reducing oil temperatures. Its innovative stacked plate design positions the transmission oil closest to the surfaces exposed to airflow, significantly improving heat dissipation and cooling efficiency. This auxiliary cooler is ideal for demanding applications where maintaining optimal transmission temperature is critical. Equipped with 5/8-18 inverted flare ports, it can be easily converted to AN fittings using adapter fittings, ensuring compatibility with Hot Rod AN LLC products for a secure and professional installation. The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler LPD4739 offers superior cooling with its durable brazed aluminum construction, delivering twice the performance of the Tru-Cool LPD. Its precise fin spacing optimizes airflow for efficient heat dissipation, making it ideal when an auxiliary transmission oil cooler is required. Installation hardware is included for a straightforward setup, ensuring reliable protection for your transmission under demanding conditions. How it works The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler LPD4739 features an advanced cold weather passive bypass that enhances fluid flow when automatic transmission fluid (ATF) is thick and viscous in low temperatures. As the ATF warms and thins during operation, the system directs it through the cooler core for efficient heat dissipation. This design ensures optimal heat transfer, maintaining ideal fluid viscosity and providing superior protection against lubrication system failure under varying temperature conditions.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8317,"endCharIdx":11448,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"i9ji/vH/f4FkrWdF12xieKE0YWcTt5QfuSv2229fSZI="}

b45e9e89-d3ae-4d46-aa73-30cb6e47337e.__data__: {"id_":"b45e9e89-d3ae-4d46-aa73-30cb6e47337e","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/tru-cool-max-40k-transmission-oil-cooler-lpd4739","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:39.602Z","content_length":13579},"excludedEmbedMetadataKeys":[],"excludedLlmMetadataKeys":[],"relationships":{"SOURCE":{"nodeId":"web:https://hotrodan.com/products/tru-cool-max-40k-transmission-oil-cooler-lpd4739","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/tru-cool-max-40k-transmission-oil-cooler-lpd4739","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:39.602Z","content_length":13579},"hash":"FwnVFxdmzBrWXkJo4+S/BCV/E47xlgkZhPkOFZRtYfo="},"PREVIOUS":{"nodeId":"1d57611f-8acc-454b-9068-3adb5a8dc089","metadata":{"source":"web","url":"https://hotrodan.com/products/tru-cool-max-40k-transmission-oil-cooler-lpd4739","fetched_at":"2025-10-12T08:41:39.602Z","content_length":13579},"hash":"LLODHE6hDodoDN27dwyLtZvZ7Pf8gUUafqGbjoOR/rc="}},"text":"The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler LPD4739 offers superior cooling with its durable brazed aluminum construction, delivering twice the performance of the Tru-Cool LPD. Its precise fin spacing optimizes airflow for efficient heat dissipation, making it ideal when an auxiliary transmission oil cooler is required. Installation hardware is included for a straightforward setup, ensuring reliable protection for your transmission under demanding conditions. How it works The Tru-Cool MAX 40K transmission oil cooler LPD4739 features an advanced cold weather passive bypass that enhances fluid flow when automatic transmission fluid (ATF) is thick and viscous in low temperatures. As the ATF warms and thins during operation, the system directs it through the cooler core for efficient heat dissipation. This design ensures optimal heat transfer, maintaining ideal fluid viscosity and providing superior protection against lubrication system failure under varying temperature conditions. BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support Derale 13 Row Series 9500 Plate & Fin Transmission Cooler Kit – 13633 Protect your transmission and improve performance with the Derale 13 Row Series 9500 Plate & Fin Transmission Cooler Kit , part number 13633 . Designed to meet the demands of light to medium duty vehicles, this cooler is a trusted solution for reducing transmission temperatures—especially during towing, hauling, or daily driving in hot conditions. High-Efficiency Cooling with OEM-Trusted Technology This transmission cooler features a durable furnace-brazed aluminum construction and an advanced plate and fin design with embossed turbulators to increase heat dissipation. These turbulators agitate fluid flow internally, ensuring maximum contact with the cooling surfaces while minimizing pressure drop. As a result, the 13-row cooler efficiently lowers fluid temperatures, helping your transmission run cooler, last longer, and perform better under load. Ideal for Light-Duty Trucks, SUVs & Occasional Towing The Derale Series 9500 transmission cooler is widely used by original equipment manufacturers for OEM towing applications due to its reliable cooling capacity and rugged construction. It's perfectly suited for: Light and medium duty pickups SUVs used for occasional towing or off-road use Daily drivers and street performance builds Vehicles operating in hot climates or hilly terrain Installation-Ready Kit with Multiple Connection Options The Derale 13633 cooler kit comes complete with everything needed for a clean, professional installation: 5/8” inverted flare inlets for secure, leak-free connections 3/8” hose barb adapters included for universal compatibility Mounting hardware and brackets for easy installation on vehicles with 5/16” transmission cooler lines Compact size for flexible mounting in tight engine bays or grille openings Product Benefits: Extend Transmission Life – Reduces overheating and heat-related wear Improve Shifting Performance – Maintains stable fluid temperature for consistent operation Reduce Maintenance Costs – Helps avoid premature transmission failure and fluid breakdown Backed by OEM Trust – Used in factory towing packages Specifications: Part Number: 13633 Cooler Type: Plate & Fin Rows: 13 Core Size: Approx. 10\" W x 7.5\" H x 0.75\" D Inlet/Outlet: 5/8\" -18 inverted flare fittings with 3/8\" hose barb adapters included Mounting Hardware: Included Why Add a Transmission Cooler? Your transmission generates extreme heat, especially when towing, climbing hills, or driving in traffic. Excessive heat is the number one killer of automatic transmissions. A quality external transmission cooler like the Derale Series 9500 helps maintain safe operating temps, preventing slippage, fluid degradation, and premature wear. If you're planning an LS swap, performance build, or just want to protect your investment, this is one of the smartest upgrades you can make.","textTemplate":"","startCharIdx":8338,"endCharIdx":12704,"metadataSeparator":"\n","type":"TEXT","hash":"KhKsymnmhnae2K3I9bZL8DLOHRUpGdR33DwmeJHqDhw="}

BIS debug Free Shipping $99+ Lifetime Warranty Expert Support AN Y Adapter Fitting – Split or Combine Fuel Flow with Precision Streamline your fuel system with our high-quality AN Y adapter fittings , designed to efficiently split or combine fluid flow in performance automotive, racing, and industrial fuel systems. Whether you're feeding dual fuel rails from a single supply line or merging two return lines into one, this Y-fitting makes complex plumbing easy and reliable. Optimize Fuel Delivery in High-Performance Builds Our AN Y adapter fittings are commonly used in advanced EFI fuel systems , especially in LS swaps and modern performance engines where dual fuel rails are utilized. Instead of running a messy crossover between rails, the Y adapter lets you feed both banks directly from one line— clean, symmetrical, and efficient . Constructed from high-strength aluminum and designed to handle the high pressures and temperatures of today’s engines, these Y adapters ensure leak-free operation and consistent flow where it matters most. Common Uses: Split one fuel feed line to supply dual fuel rails (ideal for LS swaps) Combine dual return lines into a single AN return to the tank Manage nitrous fuel delivery setups Use in custom cooling or oil circulation systems Why Choose Our AN Y Fittings? Efficient Fluid Management – Optimized flow paths to prevent restriction Leak-Free Performance – Engineered to handle high fuel pressures Clean Installation – Eliminates messy crossover plumbing and bulky tees High-Temp Durability – Compatible with gasoline, ethanol, methanol, and oils Available Sizes: AN6 – Perfect for return lines and lower-volume fuel feeds AN8 – Commonly used for high-performance fuel feeds AN10 – Ideal for high-flow fuel systems or return setups Tech Specs: Material: Lightweight CNC-machined aluminum Finish: Anodized for corrosion resistance and durability Thread Type: AN / JIC (37° flare) Configuration: Single inlet to dual outlet, or dual inlet to single outlet Fuel Safe: Yes – works with gasoline, ethanol, diesel, and oil Installation Tip: For best results, use with PTFE AN hose ends and matching hose bundles to ensure maximum sealing and flow consistency across your entire system. Y adapters should be securely mounted or supported in high-vibration areas to prevent stress on fittings.
